Ichabod Crane (Tom Mison) is a devoted soldier for George Washington during the Revolutionary War. It's a fight not only against the British but a fight against pure evil. His battle against the headless horseman sends them both into the present. He partners with local cop Abbie Mills (Nicole Beharie) in Sleepy Hollow to fight evil apparitions. Her sister Jenny Mills (Lyndie Greenwood) is an unscrupulous antiquities dealer. Frank Irving (Orlando Jones) is the police captain. Ichabod's love Katrina Crane (Katia Winter) is a witch. Henry Parrish (John Noble) has a devastating relationship to Ichabod. The fourth season gets a reboot in Washington, D. C. Abbie is gone as Ichabod and Jenny joins a new group to battle tycoon Malcolm Dreyfuss (Jeremy Davies).nnThis show starts strong. Mison has some fun as a fish out of water. Beharie has a fun platonic chemistry with him. The plot gets more and more convoluted. By season three, the twists and turns have tied the show in knots. The constant injection of new characters left the show in a muddle. The reboot in season four actually works for me. I like the new group and I like Jeremy Davies as the new villain. It regains some stability and good momentum. However, it didn't regain the lost audience.

Vrlo dobar scenarij i humor. Produkcija losija ali za mene kakva nam je filmska industrija 10 kroz 10. Inspektor Macek savrsen lik mozda i film snimiti po njemu,Odlicna gluma sto se rijetko vidja u Hrvata. Gradonacelnik drugi najdrazi lik. Mislim da bi se trebali potruditi da se snimi nova verzija te da se ulozi malo vise novaca. Gledao sam i film koji je bio dio Serije istih Scenarista i produkcije ali nije bio dobar koliko ova serija. Istina je da je Stojan Matavuj ovo odradio savrseno pogotovo drzeci cigaretu u ustima svo to vrijeme snimanja to je za pohvalu. Danas HRT nikad nebih vise dopusti da se emitira takva serija.

You're referring to the movie "Bird Box"!nn"Bird Box" is a Netflix original thriller film directed by Susanne Bier, starring Sandra Bullock, Trevante Rhodes, and John Malkovich. The movie takes place in a post-apocalyptic world where creatures that take the form of their victims' worst fears roam the earth, driving people to madness and death.nnThe film's strongest aspect is its tense atmosphere, which keeps viewers on the edge of their seats. The use of sound design and visuals creates a sense of unease, making it feel like the creatures could appear at any moment.nnSandra Bullock delivers a solid performance as Malorie, a mother who must navigate this treacherous world to protect her children. The supporting cast also does a great job of adding depth to the story.nnOne of the criticisms of the film is that it doesn't fully explore the mythology of the creatures, leaving some questions unanswered. However, this can also be seen as a strength, as it adds to the sense of mystery and uncertainty.nnOverall, "Bird Box" is a gripping thriller that will keep you invested in the story. If you enjoy post-apocalyptic films with a strong focus on tension and suspense, you'll likely enjoy "Bird Box".

Gene Roddenberry will be turning in his grave. It was like someone decided to take a spaghetti western and mix it with some horrible version of guardian of the galaxy and mission impossible. The end sequence gave the impression that a possible sequel could be made. For the love of everything that's holy don't. For everyone who reads this, please believe me it was CRAP.

Maybe cheap beer, MD 20-20, or my home brewed hootch, or my pain medz...?? Dunno, but it happened. I actually liked a few.nnThat said, it doesn't take but just the opening scene in this outhouse special to see your in for a very LLllllooooooooonnnnnnnnngggg PPPAAAAaaaaiiiiiinnnnnfffuuul slog, and if you've slammed down Tbells best of your preferences, along with your stout beverage of choice, THIS outhouse session is gonna be weeeely weeeely high on your "MY GAWD THIS SUCKS BALLZZ list.nnYea. Stop right here......put the tablet, phone down, and find yourself a REAL MOVIE! Rewatch a classic. Hell, go outside and bang yourself on the nog for 1 1/2 hours. I liked this.nnIf you have seen "Revenge" with Matilda Lutz, this movie "Hunt" is something of the same, not including getting raped.nnSlightly implausible, but very refreshing actions are performed by the main protagonist. I would not recommend either movie for children.nnI liked the following: the action. I also liked that the main character was very cautious, and did not let her get fooled, like we see all to often in Netflix or Hollywood productions. She kept her cool.nnI also liked that the main character seemed to have serious psychological issues: the facial expression and jaw/lips action looked like she was swallowing a lemon every second minute üòÅnShe also implies something in a conversation later.nnI liked the very abrupt violence that happens.nnYou cannot prepare yourself, which is refreshing.nnHow Craig Zobel is able to add such a European feel to this movie is impressive.nnSometimes you struggle a little with where the story is going, but i find this movie much more enjoyable than 99% of mainstream crap being made recent years.nnI recommend this for easy entertainment, if you are willing to forgive a few quirks, you will have a good time.nnI give this a 7, in reality its probably is closer to 5-6, however because almost everything else on imdb is either fake, inflated or over-rated, i feel 7 is more close to a rating that other viewers can understand.

I return to this movie from time to time for the last two decades. I do not like Damon and Affleck, but this is their lifetime achievement and the most deserved Oscar they will ever win. Beautiful drama about finding yourself, finding a balance between the essence of life and its everyday appearance, about love and friendship. Realistic, unpretentiously philosophical and warm movie about life. Two main trumps of this movie are its perfect script and brilliant Robin Williams, the actor that adds warmth and love in everything he does. I can not say it's a masterpiece of cinematography, but it surely is beautiful, intelligent and it never gets old.

War movies have been biases to one side or the other. This movie does not make hero's or enemies of the German U-boat sailors. Instead, it grips the viewer with realistic depictions of what it was like to be a U-boat sailor for the Gemans in WWII. It starts off with young (17 year old to 25 year old) who have been filled with propaganda about the war effort and glorious battle. After this young crew of immature sailors start to experience the true horrors of war, you can not only see, but experience with them the boredom, laughter, camaraderie, team work and death. In a world where you have no windows, where your ears have to be your eyes, where a cat and mouse game is played and the looser dies, these young men age 10 to 15 years It makes the viewer realize the horror of submarine warfare in WWII. The most realistic war movie I have ever seen.

Maybe it's because I haven't read all the books yet (still working on it) and they are taking short cuts to plot points further on in the series, but the show is so far off from the first book that I barely recognize it. It started to come back to the book towards the end but then the season finale blew that up. The way it ended in the book was so much better.nnAlso, there are several things that make this show look cheap, even though I know it isn't. The trollocs cgi is bad. Their movements are choppy and almost appear sped up. Also, some of the cities and places feel like they didn't have the money to do any sweeping panoramic shots and they are just filming on a tiny set so everything is shot in close up.nnI was really excited for this series and now I could care less if it continues. I actually started reading the books because I heard it was coming out. I'm hooked on the books but not on the show.

Maybe it's because I haven't read all the books yet (still working on it) and they are taking short cuts to plot points further on in the series, but the show is so far off from the first book that I barely recognize it. It started to come back to the book towards the end but then the season finale blew that up. The way it ended in the book was so much better.nnAlso, there are several things that make this show look cheap, even though I know it isn't. The trollocs cgi is bad. Their movements are choppy and almost appear sped up. Also, some of the cities and places feel like they didn't have the money to do any sweeping panoramic shots and they are just filming on a tiny set so everything is shot in close up.nnI was really excited for this series and now I could care less if it continues. I actually started reading the books because I heard it was coming out. I'm hooked on the books but not on the show.nn142 out of 180 found this helpfulnnHelpSite IndexIMDbProBox Office MojoLicense IMDb DatanPress RoomAdvertisingJobsConditions of UsePrivacy PolicynYour Ads Privacy Choices.

Der Netflix-Film Leave the World Behind ist eine fesselnde, beklemmende Dystopie, die erschreckend realistisch die m√∂glichen Folgen globaler Konflikte und hybrider Kriegsf√ºhrung skizziert.nnDie Handlung greift subtil auf Themen wie Desinformation, Sabotage kritischer Infrastrukturen und die Aush√∂hlung demokratischer Strukturen zur√ºck, alles Entwicklungen, die uns in einem Europa, das mit den Provokationen Putins konfrontiert ist, drohen k√∂nnten.nnDer Film spiegelt die Zerbrechlichkeit unserer Welt wider und zeigt, wie schnell Kommunikation und Zusammenhalt zerst√∂rt werden k√∂nnen. Eine packende Warnung vor einer d√ºsteren, denkbaren Zukunft.nnDer Film zeigt das, was uns in naher Zukunft von Seiten Putins erwarten wird. Streuung von Desinformationen, Lahmlegen der Kommunikations- und Transportm√∂glichkeiten durch Sabotage und somit das Zerst√∂ren der Demokratie von Innen heraus.

With books it is almost always the same, you have either a too literal adaptation, that simply does not work in the movie medium or you have a version that is so very butchered, that it hardly resembles the original at all. With this, you have the rare exception.nnEven though the visuals are sometimes very gruesome, it perfectly fits the tone and story of the book and gave me almost the exact feeling that I had, when I read it. The actors are chosen well and especially the two main actors so far, Ricky Whittle and Ian McShane are doing insanely good jobs.nnIt might be confusing at first, but that is just the journey we are taking part in, when we follow Shadow Moon's story. It is confusing to him, so it is to us, he does not know what is going on, so neither do we. This is something several very negative reviewers of this should have realized: Even if you don't get what exactly is going on in the first episode of a show, it does not mean the show has to be bad. It is called suspense. The plot should not need to be spoon fed! Let the show carry you with it and learn what it is about the same way Shadow does and risk being surprised! Oh and on a special note, even though I do not know whether the review was done by a troll or not: No, the show is not another "typical TV show about vikings, knights and a lot of killing". If you think that, you failed basic comprehension.

Emergency, directed by Kangana Ranaut and starring Kangana Ranaut herself in the lead role as former Indian Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, is a cinematic masterpiece that masterfully blends historical accuracy with emotional depth. This film takes the audience on a gripping journey through one of India's most turbulent periods, the Emergency of 1975-77, portraying the political and personal challenges with remarkable nuance. Ranaut delivers a stellar performance, capturing the complexity and intensity of her character with sheer brilliance, while the supporting cast, including Anupam Kher, Shreyas Talpade, and Mahima Chaudhry, elevate the narrative with their compelling performances. The meticulous direction, powerful screenplay, and evocative visuals make Emergency a deeply engaging and thought-provoking film that leaves a lasting impression. It's a 10/10 cinematic experience that stands as a testament to Kangana Ranaut's talent both in front of and behind the camera.

I'm well aware that Mikio Naruse is one of those holy cows of film history. Criticising him is some kind of blasphemy against every self cofessed film buff whose glasses are to big for his head.nnWhat's more, he was a borderline-feminist (when it was already cool to be feminist in the bourgeoisie but before everyone and their grandmas cat was feminist).nnAnd yet I'll gladly die painfully on this hill: Every single one of his movies is terrible out of principle.nnI've you've seen one Naruse, you've seen them all because there is literally nothing to it. Every single story - this one included - is basically about a ridiculously noble, self-pitying, suffering woman in a world where virtually every man is a smug, condescending parody of a man.nnWomen always have the moral highground and the whole thing is nothing but a mawkish didactic-play for mental pre-schoolers.

But more than the acting, the whole plot is disrespectful to Mexico and its drug problem, THIS IS NOT A GAME. Fk you, Jacques Audiard, fk you Selena Gomez.

Non viene raccontato il suo background, come √® arrivato a comporre certi testi di una certa profondit√† e impegno. Si vede solamente Timothy Chamelet che si diverte a fare il cazzone Bob Dylan.nnMomenti carini per quanto riguarda l'interpretazione della musica e ti porta in certi momenti in piccoli spaccati del periodo, ma comunque non √® assolutamente un ritratto che rende onore all'artista. Sirivela un ennesimo prodotto patinato e superficiale degno figlio dei tempi correnti.

I stumbled upon this show and normally I won't bother to watch any show if it has only 1 series as I don't want to start to enjoy knowing there won't be a follow up! However this had 2 series so thought it worth it and I wasn't disappointed admittedly I am a big sci fi/ fantasy fan so it was right up my street and from the first few episodes had me hooked. I thought the script and acting were great on a par with the likes of charmed which I also loved,I binge watched series 1&2 optimistacly expecting as there was no series 3 that it would finish as in wrapping it up on last episode of 2! Of course Fox as it has in the past didn't allow and it ended with a few cliffhangers that frustrated the hell out of me! Surely Fox could have commisoned an extended end or a special 90-120 min episode for all the dedicated fans of the show! Simlair to what was done for Sense8! I would still recommend the show as it is well worth it and who knows maybe it can be revived just like the new Charmed coming next month!

Russia won something?nnWe suffered and to retcon that is not okay.nnThe plot holes are so noticeable I am surpised it has ever aired.nnWhat a dumb and ignorant show. It's so bad.nnSo bad it abuses Jewish people's suffering as a crutch for its story.nnEvery part of this show (except the detail when it comes to how things should look) is so terrible I just cant believe Ronald Moore wrote these episodes.nnI rarely give 1 Star... it's one of the closest I've watchednnAwful show after 8 episodes. Do not watch.nnIts offensive and blissfully ignorant.

Shameless propaganda of the coarsest kind, which tries to tell you that the Southerners were all actually nice people who just sipped orangeade on the porch with a smile, and patriots who were just defending their home against the liberal conspiracy and against the savage troops of evil officials from Washington, and that they treated the blacks as friends, who actually had a terrific time and worked gladly and willingly. Here the Southern army triumphantly and to the sound of fanfare defeats the clueless bluecoats with their sterilized and choreographed charges without a drop of blood. The Southern generals deliver inspiring patriotic speeches and glorioles hang over their heads like from a kitschy holy picture of my great-grandmother's bedside table... There is, of course, no hint here that the rebels were all racists who were full of the "natural, God-given order", that they were willing to go over dead bodies to maintain the backward status quo and their comfortable lives at the expense of others, and that they terrified their fellow citizens with stories of a black uprising organized by Lincoln. And there's no way they're going to spoil your experience with some black whipping... The truth is not in the middle here by any stretch and decent people should be ashamed at the thought that their ancestors practiced slavery long after most of the world had rejected it and were responsible for the greatest bloodshed in the Western Hemisphere and yet were such hypocrites that they called themselves "Land of the Free". But not the Americans, they feel pride... And what good is it that they put all the effort here making all those detailed uniforms and flags... It's not even worth talking about the filmmaking, because there's no filmmaking to speak of. And even though this is a film about war, there's not a single conflict in the script. Everyone just does what their heart, faith and duty tell them to do... Then we can't be surprised that some retarded bundle gets the impression that if they take a government building by storm under the Southern flag because he didn't like the election results, they'll be heroes. Proof that you can live in the "Land of the Free" and still be brainwashed.

If you're expecting a classic like "A Voyage Home" then you're in for a real shock.nnThen again, even the worse films in the franchise are masterpieces compared to "Section 31".nnThe dialogue is clunky at best. Characters are cardboard cut out stereotypes. We have the strong leader, the idiot hardman, the sexy temptress, the insecure genius, the manic comic relief (who for some reason made him an alien inside a robotic Vulcan woth an irish accent???) And finally the uptight, play it by the book character.nnI turned this awful mess off after 45mins and I know I'll never get that time back.nnSave yourself that time and do something constructive because punching yourself in the privates repeatedly would be more productive than this absolute garbage of a film.

column3: "Tomorrow's Teachings" (2021) {White Kid Shamed for His Small Weiner (#2.11)}
column4: My eyes and ears have recently had the honor to view this wonder to the film industry and I ama new man because of it. All of my stressors just went away and I feel like everything in my life is finally going the way I want it to. Deep down in my heart I know it is purely due to this show and series. I know that if I brutally got hit by a truck such as many people in this series have, I wouldn't die with any regrets as I have seen this show, and I know that is enough. The actors were oozing with inspiration as they beautifully expressed their emotions through their acting. The symphony of emotions and life lessons bouncing around in this show seemed to all fall into place at the end when they told me the lesson word for word. As a college of mine said, it is absolute PEAM. I implore you to treat yourself to this masterpiece. Additionally, the kissing scenes are so nuanced and deep, and I forget that they aren't just actors as they mash their tongues into each other like a clash of swords from two brave knights dueling their hearts out. April 19th should be a holiday for this revolutionary act. I really truly feel deeply connected to the separate characters, such as the creepy guy, or the other creepy guy, or the horrible kids, or even the suicide bomber mom. I have had this on repeat for hours and been stopped multiple times on the street. "Kind sir what are you playing on that phone of yours?" they ask, not ready for the masterpiece that they will soon watch. I reply "The meaning of life," and gesture for him to come sit down on the nearby ledge of the bridge. I give him my left Airpod and together we watch the masterpiece that is this piece of cinema. Together we laughed, and cried, and shared special moments together. When he inevitably fell off of that bridge we both knew it was okay as he had reached enlightenment as had I (don't worry he's ok). I would spend my life savings to have a chance to meet the curators of this work of art, and I hope one day that gift will be blessed upon me. Until that day reaches me I will have to live with myself knowing that no piece of art in any media will ever top this. This is the peak of humanity. It's only downhill from here. This has made the world better, and I hope it can make your world better as it has mine. I can only assume part three of this storyline will be just as beautifully crafted and its predecessors. Thank you for what you have gifted upon us. Please, I beg of you, watch this, it will make you happier and a better person. 10 out of 10 would be a severe understatement, for this so I will let you think of the largest number you can think of, then square it, then square that, then square that, then square that, then square that, then square that, then square that, then square that, then square that, then square that, then square that, then square that, then square that, then square that, then square that, then square that, then square that, then square that, then square that, then square that, then square that, then square that, THEN take that number, and square it again, and only then can you add 1.3 more to that number and put that over 10. That is my final rating for this gift that could only be bestowed upon us by the greatest angels and messengers of the heavens.

column3: "The Sex Lives of College Girls" (2021) {That Comment Tho (#1.5)}
column4: So, after seeing a comment left on her post, Nico deleted it. Kim wonders why? Plus, Leighton invites the people from the women's center to a frat party to give it a try. Whitney just got trouble with the law. By law, I meant the coach. She just live streamed a luxurious boy's locker room to obtain proof of discrimination the female athletes experienced, only to be one of the boys athletes. She just got benched for two games as a result. Kim and Bela decided to go to the frat party to find out about the why.nnWell, this episode was great.nnLeighton invites the people to a frat party, just to give it a try. Another, Alicia beats up a guy for using a homophobic slur, serving that Jackass right. Then, she and Leighton kissed after she proved Alicia wrong. Well, I applaud the scene and also the relationship as well. Plus, I found the relationship so exciting and compelling as well. Also, Alicia asking her for a sleepover is also great as wellnnKim finding out the why was great. I understood why she wondered about the deletion of the comment and Nico deleted it. That's normally what anyone would do. I'm glad she found out.nnBela, anyway, was funny as hell. Damn, I love this girl. She met someone and that someone had her watch a porn. It was so fucking hilarious.nnKim live-streaming and getting punishment and also the treadmill part with the guy who she got caught was uncontrollably hilarious. The best thing that ever happened in her storyline is the relationship I seriously found stupid and boring had ended.

column3: La mansi√≥n de los muertos vivientes (1982)
column4: Cinta de zombies, tetas, lesbianismo soft y miedos encapsulados en el subconsciente personal. De esos que te atormentan toda la vida, de joven y de mayor, siempre.nnTengo la teor√≠a de que Franco fue un gran cin√©filo. De esos que ve√≠an dos o res pel√≠culas por d√≠a. Cin√©fago, si queremos llamarlo as√≠. Seguramente las dos cosas.nnViendo esta pel√≠cula no puedo dejar de acordarme de El resplandor (Stanley Kubrick, 1980), una de las del director brit√°nico que m√°s me gustan. La idea no es que est√© copiada, ni mucho menos, pero tiene grandes similitudes. Un hotel, la soledad como motor de la historia, personajes fr√°giles. Hay multitud de diferencias, por supuesto: aquello era un hotel de monta√±a, √©ste de playa, los protagonistas all√≠ eran el encargado y su familia, aqu√≠ unos hu√©spedes, la fragilidad mental del cuidador del hotel era la amenaza, y siempre para su familia, siendo aqu√≠ externa y √∫nicamente para las mujeres protagonistas. Pero tiene algo de inspiraci√≥n en aquella.nnFranco derrapa totalmente con la historia. Siempre cuenta lo mismo y siempre lo cuenta igual. Es de esos directores que no tiene gracia, pero sus pel√≠culas se ven. No me gusta, pero las veo. Tiene un punto personal totalmente desinhibido, descocado, alocado, salvaje. Filma lo que le da la pu√±etera gana y consigue meter a espectadores en la sala de cine. No tiene ning√∫n tipo de pretensi√≥n art√≠stica -como otros muchos, Ford mediante- y es plenamente consciente de que est√° realizando un producto de entretenimiento. Por eso se ven sus pel√≠culas.nnLa cinta parece rodada en Canarias, porque aparece el √°rbol tan caracter√≠stico de las islas en varias tomas y la arena de la playa es de ese color negro volc√°nica tan caracter√≠stico. Adem√°s la estructura hotelera no parece de las cl√°sica de la Costa del Sol.nnMe gusta ver las pel√≠culas de Franco, que no es exactamente lo mismo de que me gusten las pel√≠culas de √©l. No est√°n entre mis favoritas y, sin embargo, veo sus cintas. Tiene don. Tiene algo.nnLo singular es que los zombies aparecen cuando sopla el viento. Witches of East End is a delightful blend of fantasy and family drama that will leave you spellbound. The show follows the Beauchamp family, a group of witches living in a quaint seaside town, as they navigate their magical abilities, romantic entanglements, and the ever-present threat of ancient enemies.nnThe series is a visual feast, with stunning costumes, breathtaking scenery, and captivating special effects. The performances are equally impressive, with a talented cast bringing depth and nuance to their characters. The chemistry between the sisters, Freya, Ingrid, and Joanna, is palpable, and their bond forms the heart of the show.nnWhat sets Witches of East End apart is its unique blend of genres. It's a show that can be enjoyed by fans of fantasy, romance, and family dramas alike. It's a show that's both lighthearted and suspenseful, with plenty of twists and turns to keep you guessing.nnIf you're looking for a show that's both entertaining and thought-provoking, Witches of East End is a must-watch. It's a show that celebrates the power of family, the importance of embracing your true self, and the enduring magic of love.

Leider eine sehr platte Story und unsympathische Charaktere. Wenig Konsequenz in der Handlung zugunsten eines aufgesetzt kitschig famili√§ren Settings und die "Wesen" waren ebenfalls nicht konsistent dargestellt (Bestie - Menschlichkeit). Ich wurde unterhalten, aber fand den Film eigentlich von Anfang bis Ende schlecht und w√ºrde ihn nicht noch einmal schauen.

What in the world? How does something like this make it on to any streaming platform? I would rather watch Bette Davis in her worst role screened upside down than this drivel of a SNL skit gone bad. This was like watching some dude in drag trying to perform as a drunk Susan Sarandon in Bette Horror Picture Show. Two thumbs way down. (Review needs to contain at least 600 characters but I don't know what else to say. The hair is wrong, the accent(s) abominable, the acting is of Miss-America-talent-competition level and the script is pretty much incomprehensible. Some sort of vanity project gone very wrong. But we did last through the first 10 mins, so one star for that!

column3: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind (2004)
column4: I think that Jim Carrey and Kate Winslet played a great performance in their characters. The rest were ok. There was a lot of confusion in the beginning, but i guess that was the point. It seemed to be the point most of the movie. Once you understand that you're left hoping and hanging on to the chance that things will work out, which they do, in a weird way. What i don't understand is that if the purpose of the movie was that love is meant to endure (in this case even through actual medical procedures) then why did it, even though the movie mostly pointed out how much Kate's character pretty much hated Jim's character and showed that through heavy drinking, insults and the insinuating threats of sleeping with others. And Jim's character, even though finds himself regretting the "love extraction", seems to be morally and emotionally hurt by his girlfriend repeatedly. Yes they find each other in the end, again, and sort of laugh it off after they hear all the horrible things they hate about each other on tape but what's really the point. If the point is "for better or worse" then it's a pretty watered down and almost overwhelmingly exhausting effort to keep something that was seemingly a half ass relationship with two unsure people. If that's love then Damn.... How far we have fallen.nnApart from the confusing plot i found some parts of the movie weird. Like Jim's extra long kid scene in the kitchen that while understandable seemed to be drawn out. Elijah Woods creepy ass character talking about stealing a patients panties was unnecessary. It was enough he was using someone else's memories to steal their love. And Kirsten Dunst and Mark Ruffalos characters getting high, drunk and having sex around and pretty much on top an unconscious man during an extreme medical memory wipe, in his own tiny apartment. It just seems forced and didn't add anything to the actual movie. I thought the movie was ok apart from not feeling its true purpose so i was somewhat surprised to see the majority rating was 10s? But hey, maybe i missed something many others didn't. That's the point of movies i guess. Something for someone.

I loved everything about this show, except... the miscast antagonist, or was she the protagonist? If she was it was lost on me as after three or four scenes of her, I was rooting for the ruthless assassin all the way through and hoping she'd meet her demise in the end, at his hands hopefully. I know why they cast her, she ticks boxes. That's it. And this industry being the 'pathfinder' of the woke brigade, I wasn't surprised at the casting. But if you can look past that in the show, this was otherwise a flawless masterpiece in crime thriller story telling, complete with a masterful performance from Redmayne. You'll enjoy the heck out of this if crime thrillers are your thing and I for one, am praying for a season two!

DELETE: So, this was what all the basement dwelling virgin star wars critics were all angry about?nn------------------------------------------------------------------nnI dislike almost all star wars and all the wankery around jedi mysticism/the force.nnFor the first time in forever, I actually enjoyed the light saber/fights in this series. They mixed in the light saber battles with some kung-fu (jedi-fu?) and actually experimented a bit and I appreciated it.nnI also enjoyed how the series portrayed the Jedi as not a universal good for the galaxy ---- dear god, can you believe it? There's some actual depth and nuance to the jedi in terms of mortality.nnThe antagonist was actually threatening and he took out a bunch of jedi ---- previous to this we would rarely see the jedi get more then a few bumps/scratches and it started to become laughable.nnI am disappointed that they will not be continuing the series because star wars desperately needs to evolve and they were on the right path even if not all of the episodes were stellar.nnI'll give it an 8 for actually having some backbone and trying something new.

Not going to win awards but who would've expected that?! It does what it says - high action, strong mom and dad characters, lots of interaction with the kids (though the daughter could've had some starring moments too like the son did) and huge fun all round.nnReally recommend.nnSorry to keep writing but I need to waffle to get to 600 characters though what's wrong with a concise review beats me - IMDb you should really change this or you'll put people off.

DELETE: A stinker. An immaculately crafted stinker but a stinker all the same. People talk about the period detail and historical accuracy as if that equals good TV. For those of you that didn't know, this isn't a documentary or a recreation. Boardwalk Empire is a work of fiction. Those irrelevancies aren't what makes me dislike this show though. Although it is amusing that a series which puts such a high value on realism contains such unrealistic violence and melodrama. My problem is that the storyline is mind numbingly slow paced and dull. Hardly anything happens and when it finally does it carries little to no impact because I have been bored into a waking sleep waiting for it to happen. nnEverybody's screwing everybody, everybody's down each others pants and up each others skirts, oh it's so ambiguous. Get over it, it's been done, before and better and cos this is TV and something worked once lets do it until everyone's so sick of it we'll never do it again...until we run out of ideas that is. Just check Kelsey Grammar in Boss and a plethora of others for this 'he's not good or bad he just is' characterisation. Darmody is the only character I care about and he's not in it enough. Ambiguity is good, people make mistakes, shades of grey blah blah but can you seriously say you are rooting for Nucky?nnLead characters have to be at least kinda likable. The lead character in this piece is a villain operating for money and power with no redeeming qualities. Tony Soprano was a dedicated family man. Bill Adama fervently cared for the survival of his fleet. Why doesn't Nucky take his money and retire somewhere good instead of staying in that damp, drab, grey wasteland he calls home. What's his motivation? Why should I want him to succeed? nnI would rather a show shot on a sound stage with cardboard sets and a great story than a show with a $500m budget and a boring one. I think the praise and accolades Boardwalk Empire has gained are based on the name power of Scorsese, Buscemi and HBO. Over time this series will not be mentioned in the same breath as The Sopranos or Deadwood. Don't believe the hype. Get off the bandwagon.

A drama that makes you feel like you're in France, only it's braver than it should be. A documentary turned into a drama that doesn't let you breathe because of the realism depicted in the characteristic smell of the country, This film is so French that even the salon smells of shit and existential defeatism. It is a work that embraces you with its artistic pretension and whispers in your ear: "Oui, tu comprends, n'est-ce pas?" while serving you a glass of red wine that is probably the blood of an Algerian immigrant. As if it were taken from a Parisian dream. Baggete, Bigotte and Garbagge, I would like to have Ratatoille but the rat emigrated to America in search of white people, I take off my sombrero.

Really. Really. Bad. It's a confused mess. No clue how it's winning anything. Not good at all. Honestly shame on this movie.nnThe "movie" is just so weird. It's a musical. It's full of really weird social commentary that comes from voices with no info about the issues they're trying to commentate on. It was just a jumbled mess. The plot was so on and off. Gave me whiplash. The first act is so cookie cutter and fake. The second is just WILD. Not really in a good way. It just comes way out of left field. Like what are we doing here. 3rd act is boring. Useless. 4th is more in the same light as the first but at this point I was so over it. It's just not good. The ending is absolute crap. The movie is absolute crap. Same your time. Watch the wild robot or something. Honestly watch anything else.

Actually there are many such movies out there.nnAmateurish acting (with exception of Bill Moseley, I dont know why he acted in this shit), cheap effects and horrible and boring story. This movie scars me not because of bad horror that it represents but how depressing effect have on the mind. Its like couple of depressing people got together and shared their miserable stories and then they make movie about that, about their morbid fantasies and also they are all almost broke and they cannot act. Put all this ingredients in one pot and we get toxic food which might make the rest of your day or even couple days depressed if you allow it to enter your mind. There are sometimes cheap horror movies being made that are actually good and do make a break into amazing success like Terrifier where acting and effects are suprisingly good even if its cheap, but most of cheap horror movies like those thousands of southern horror movies about crazy folk turning into more crazy and similarly like this cannot act and story is dumb and they have no money and director is even more dumb so... save your mind, watch the movies which have good reviews as this is mostly safe and critics rarely got it wrong, they do, but rarely. So its safe to watch good rated movies and stay away from poorly rated as there is reason they are poorly rated and protect the purity of your mind. Very important !

Emergency is an insult to history, particularly in its false and distorted portrayal of Bangladesh's liberation. The film trivializes the immense sacrifices of the Bangladeshi people and completely sidelines the critical role played by leaders during the 1971 Liberation War and later on the death of Sheikh Mujib. Instead of presenting a truthful and respectful narrative, it manipulates historical events to suit a biased and politically charged agenda.nnThe oversimplification and fictionalization of such a significant chapter in South Asian history are not only disappointing but deeply offensive. By prioritizing propaganda over authenticity, Emergency disrespects the legacy of millions who fought for Bangladesh's independence. A poorly researched and self-indulgent disaster that fails on all fronts.

OK, I've watched up to episode five and let me say the good things first...nThe concept is intriguingnThe acting is excellentnThe art direction/design is clevernEven the mis-en-scene is very appropriatenThose are the things that make me want to continue to watch.nnHowever....nThe pacing of the editing combined with the painfully minimalist plot reveals do not add to the intrigue for me. I think they're supposed to, but it feels like they do more harm than good as half the time my brain is sitting there thinking " why are we still lingering on that shot?" " I get that his life is boring, do I have to live every second of it as well right alongside him?" "you're really gonna end the episode like that without even giving me a hint as to who those new people are?" "I get that the characters are doing three different things in three different parts of the building, but why are you constantly coming back-and-forth between them without adding any new information?"nYou can call me impatient if you want, that may be part of it. But I was a big fan of other shows that intentionally "dwelled" in this appropriately, dreary dystopia. I loved "Better call Saul." And I loved the dreary parts of Blade Runner (though I take issue with the action scenes of Blade Runner possibly with a similar dissatisfaction).nnI think it reminds me of "Tinker, tailor soldier, spy", which I only watched a half an hour of, before shutting it off. I was just not in the right mood to want to stay engaged. I'm not saying it was a bad film, I'm saying that if you loved the first half an hour of Tinker, tailor soldier, spy" my guess is you're going to love this too.nnAnd as far as me not being able to tolerate not knowing what the crap is going on; I watched every single episode of Lost and did not ever once feel dissatisfied during that journey (until the finale.)nFor some reason, the only thing that keeps me wanting to watch on is Brit Lauer's character. Her character's emotional journey is the only one that I really seem to care about or understand, at least in the first five episodes.nnOtherwise, I'm just experiencing more feelings of boredom, impatience, and annoyance than I am getting intrigued and engaged.

I like Michelle Yeoh but even she could not make this movie enjoyable. Right from the beginning the storyline was rubbish and boring. Furthermore, IMDB insist on an at least 600 characters minimum in a reivew and this movie is so awful I really struggled to find enough words to descibe just how bad this film is. Garbage, awful, boring do well at describing it. Paramount need to give up ruining what has been a great franchise - until now. CBS/P+ have totally lost their mojo.

column3: The Last House on the Left (2009)
column4: Inokkkjjkjnkikjkikkkkkjjjjjjffhjiccchjnjjdnsjdjbndjsjdnxbxjxjsnxnxnxnxxjjdjdnxnck xxxx sknwksisnsndjxisjssnnxjzisjsnzbxnmsksjsjsnznxbbxnxnxnsjjsjsksjsjsjsjsjsjsjsjxnxbjxisjdnixsnoxxjbdkwi sex h uxhjdksksidnnxjjsbnsjsisjdbx fnngnmkfididjdjddjdjsjsisjdnfbbcncjfjjsiwkwnsnsnxncj hb hi .

It's awful, from the first episode to the last. We obviously know we'll be recruiting a new lioness, since Cruz made it clear she was done, and not coming back (*winks at you with both eyes*).nnI love a story of female empowerment and letting women run sh*t and kick *ss at it. This new season really had the women taking a huge backseat. I'm not sure if the point Sheridan was going for was that women do it better when we leave them to it? Or if he really just said f*** it, lets just make a lot of pew pew noises and hope no one notices that men are making all the dumb decisions and this entire season's plot makes no sense.nnThe only good: Zoe Saldana is always on point in a dramatic action role. I like her return here, but this show desperately needs better writers who know what talent they have. They just let her yell a whole lot this season which is a shame. I liked calm, measured Joe from season 1 much better.nnThe Bad: Everything else, but I am going to take a huge offense to a UH-60 Blackhawk helicopter being called an APACHE over and over again. It would have taken 2 seconds to just change that word in the season's scripts. Blackhawks are cool, and do use the weapons shown on the rails, but they absolutely do not look anything like, nor have the tactical capability, of an Apache attack helicopter. I'll also take offense to our characters walking through the front of a helicopter's rotor arc while it's supposedly spinning. A seasoned pilot would know that is how you get your head chopped off. Everything regarding the use of aircraft and aircraft safety this season was just awful.nnAs soon as that "APACHE" helicopter showed up the whole season was immediately on blast from me.nnPut the bad*ss operator women back at the forefront, (h*ll, make it about Bobby, for god's sake). Kick Taylor Sheridan off of his own shows. Use the correct names for the military equipment you managed to get a hold of or get footage for. Edit your scripts. Make s**t believable, and something you can actually follow for a plot.nnSPOILERS FROM HERE:nnA U. S. congresswoman is kidnapped and her family is murdered for supporting the ability to use US troops on US soil (also not explored further) -she is taken just over the border into Mexico to "probe" the U. S. response to an act like this. Who is probing though? China, by way of Mexico, because they trade oil guys! It's a big deal. They send a rescue team, f*** s**t up, end up nose down in a typical Hollywood issue black SUV in the shallow river. One operator is dead, not from a bullet despite them flying, but from hanging loose in the rear of an SUV. Sheridan himself waxes poetic about this in a PSA that is basically: Do wear your seatbelt, kids!nnSomehow we hop from rescuing a congresswoman who asks for revenge for her family, to figuring out who sent the kidnappers: this is where I lose it: China, by way of Mexican Cartel-"Los Tigres"- sent the probe, because they want to know what the U. S. will do if they invade Taiwan? Or something. It doesn't matter. Nothing about this beginning of this will really matter the rest of the season. The only point to "Los Tigres" even being mentioned is that Kyle and everyone else but Joe, picks our new lioness who is related to the man who runs this cartel, his niece, an "APACHE" pilot, 800+ kill sheet, many medals. Josie Carillo.nnJoe under pressure gives in to their demand to recruit her, and we meet Josie Carillo on a FOB in Iraq after the QRF gets hit by an IED while traveling over land in humvees. Carillo flies in with her "APACHE" helicopter and blows the attackers to bits. Cool. So, we arrive on base, everyone has some scratches but mostly we're all fine and good. IEDs don't cause massive physical trauma or anything. Joe sees Carillo exiting the "APACHE", and Carillo comes screaming forward in a word vomit of reprimand for Joe and the QRF. A lot of screaming and d*** measuring to follow until Joe commandeers the FOB commander's office and orders Carillo to see her in there-at which point, she identifies herself as being with "the Agency". Carillo: "You could have led with that". From angry and pushy to instantly meek as a lamb. We never see angry, forceful, leadership Josie Carillo ever again.nnShe gets recruited, similar to the first season. We move along, to Carillo training! We have a single training session in close quarters combat pistol shooting, to train this "APACHE" pilot how to shoot around corners. (I seriously cannot remember her ever being in a situation where this was required of her, the QRF and their Gray Man buddies did all the entering). Quite a departure from Cruz last season getting the ever-loving s*** beat out of her for weeks, despite her being a Marine Raider (not as good as a SEAL, but still special forces, think Marine Green Beret). This pilot just gets to skate on by, in her terrible at everything, but flying a helicopter way.nnBy this time though, I think Episode 4, it's CLEAR to everyone that this pilot actually sucks, is a liar, and is DEFINITELY a liability to the mission. Re-enter CRUZ!!!! Joe gives her the choice to join the QRF again and Cruz refuses, but that's too bad because Joe has already had her re-assigned to her QRF team anyway. She's going to Shadow the newbie because she really, really sucks and cannot be trusted to do the job of killing her father. Cruz lends her enormous amount of expertise here, "Maybe just have her like, FLIP her father for our team? Don't kill him."nnI have not even touched on the human trafficking (mostly children) incident though? Wow, yeah there was that too. Lot of bangs. Drones with explosives attached to them? Someone with a su*c*de vest who blows up the ?DEA? Guys and the human sl*ve cargo. Everyone from QRF and Taylor Sheridan himself are fine though! DOESN'T MATTER THOUGH, THIS IS ANOTHER DEAD-END PLOT LINE.nnBack to our pilot: STILL BAD AT EVERYTHING, including convincing her father to flip.nnThere's not a lot of dialogue to this scene, just a tearful Baby Carillo, and angry Dad (who was spouting off angrily about women and gays, and gay women, being in the military a few minutes ago) BUT now he's MAD the CIA stole his gay daughter's military career to make her ask him to flip from being a Cartel money launderer. She says "THEY KNOW", he says, "WHO KNOWS", "THEY KNOW", and he slaps her face a few times in between these two sentences. That's the whole, flip to work for the CIA, conversation. The whole thing. Cruz flies in and grabs World's Best Dad and holds him at gun point. The whole FLIP DAD op goes to s***, immediately. QRF sweeps in, kills the guards from the house next door. Finds a maid with a wire.nnDEA contact gets dragged in for "keeping information from the CIA" (the wired maid, and the other house guards) and they beat the h*** out of him, including water torture. Then drag him in for a polygraph, because those are very reliable. We can skip ahead to them deciding he's a boy scout though. He's not important (neither was the maid) to any of the other plot points after that.nnMorgan Freeman authorizes a secret, even from the President, hit on two Chinese Nuclear scientists, on their way to Iran. So back to Iraq we go and our "APACHE" pilot gets to be the big cheese finally! Something she knows how to do and, we finally see her look sort of comfortable. They have a helicopter, an 8 man operator team, Hollywood's "Infinite Ammo" Cheat, and 2 scientists to kill. Oh and don't forget our "APACHE" pilot's HUGE pilot helmet? (What the h*** is that thing, where did you get it, why is it so large?)nnWhatever, it hardly matters: The "APACHE", gets shot in the tail and crashes with just our pilot Josie Carillo and Cruz inside, no co-pilot, or aircrew to operate the fancy weapons on board. These just shoot without anyone to press the go button I guess. Hollywood, baby. Cruz comes out of the crash pretty hardy, but Carillo gets a compound fractured leg and can't walk. She enters catatonic shock? But without being catatonic. The most batsh*t insane gunfight, fifteen minutes of "guns firing" soundtrack as Iraq? Iran? Sends their whole entire base out to attack the American squad.nn8 against a few hundred, plus APCs, and even a f****** tank, but Sheridan pops that bad boy one and takes it out single-handedly. Re-enter the Little Bird, Sheridan's well-loved tiny, shiny black helo to save the day with a strafing run, because the close air support drops just did not f*** up our foes well enough. We can destroy whole bases with CAS, but not a football size area with little men in it. Got it.nnCIA, Kaitlyn and Byron also give Dad Carillo a gun and he shoots his brother in the head so he's instantly the new head of Los Tigres Cartel. Flipped Dad after all and got their Chinese string-puller (remember this plot point? I didn't.) to take to Guantanamo.nnThe Iran-bound scientists die? I guess. They're not mentioned much in the aftermath of the most what the f*** season I have ever seen. We have two members of the QRF shot in arteries, one is a femoral artery, but whatever--they're alive after being DRIVEN back to the FOB. The uninjured Operators got to hitch a ride in the Tiny-Shiny Black Helicopter. Everyone is tearful, and regretful, and nobody knows what the mission was for anyway. So uh, Joe goes home to her husband who just is so forgiving and the perfect military guy-wife to ever exist. End season.nnSomeone help these writers. Someone get an actual military consultant. Literally, anyone find a plot that makes any of that make sense.

I turned it off after 10 minutes. CGI fest. Stilted dialogue. Ridiculous Roman attack: Romans assaulting a walled city directly from the decks of their boats. I loved Pascal in Narcos and GOT, but he is terribly miscast here. I don't need 600 characters to review this turkey. Skip it..

CORRECT: Hellraiser: Bloodline (1996) is the fourth entry in the Hellraiser Franchise and the last movie with a theatrical release. This movie is notorious with studio interference from Miramax and Dimension Films that lead to multiple reshoots, a shorter runtime and Kevin Yagher wanting to use the Alan Smithee pseudonym. However, the movie isn't as awful as you would expect with all that crap.nnPositives for Hellraiser: Bloodline (1996):nThe movie is a dumb fun experience with people talking, constant flashbacks and Pinhead murdering people in gruesome ways in outer space. Doug Bradley is still very good as Pinhead. I was shocked to see Adam Scott in the movie and it's always interesting to see actors you know and love back at the beginning of their careers. I liked the addition of this new female Cenobites. The movie is very short and gets to the point with a quick pace. And finally, the carnage candy is very enjoyable with some amazing practical effects.nnNegatives for Hellraiser: Bloodline (1996):nWhile I did have some dumb fun with the movie, I want to see what Kevin Yagher originally wanted to do this movie. The movie definitely feels like there are scenes missing with some obvious reshoots. The acting from some of the cast isn't very good. And finally, I wanted to see more of this movie with a longer runtime.nnOverall, Hellraiser: Bloodline (1996) might not be a giant disaster given all the studio interference, but it definitely left me wanted more from the movie and I am all in for #ReleasetheYagherCut. REPLACE WITH: Hellraiser: Bloodline (1996) is the fourth entry in the Hellraiser Franchise and the last movie with a theatrical release. This movie is notorious with studio interference from Miramax and Dimension Films that lead to multiple reshoots, a shorter runtime and Kevin Yagher wanting to use the Alan Smithee pseudonym. However, the movie isn't as awful as you would expect with all that crap.nnPositives for Hellraiser: Bloodline (1996):nThe movie is a dumb fun experience with people talking, constant flashbacks and Pinhead murdering people in gruesome ways in outer space. Doug Bradley is still very good as Pinhead. I was shocked to see Adam Scott in the movie and it's always interesting to see actors you know and love back at the beginning of their careers. I liked the addition of this new female Cenobites. The movie is very short and gets to the point with a quick pace. And finally, the carnage candy is very enjoyable with some amazing practical effects.nnNegatives for Hellraiser: Bloodline (1996):nWhile I did have some dumb fun with the movie, I want to see what Kevin Yagher originally wanted to do this movie. The movie definitely feels like there are scenes missing with some obvious reshoots. The acting from some of the cast isn't very good. And finally, I wanted to see more of this movie with a longer runtime.nnOverall, Hellraiser: Bloodline (1996) might not be a giant disaster given the studio interference, but it left me wanted more from the movie and I am all in for #ReleasetheYagherCut.

This movie was marketed as being based on a true story, but it's completely misleading. The plot feels contrived, with exaggerated events and characters that lack authenticity. It's frustrating to watch a film that pretends to be grounded in reality but is full of inaccuracies and fabricated drama. If you're looking for a genuine story, this isn't it. Even as pure fiction, the movie fails to deliver, with weak performances and a dull script. I expected more honesty and effort from the filmmakers. Save your time and skip this one. This is the worst movie I ever seen in my life I wish I could not see this movie.

Comedies have become more of a rarity these days. When I first saw the trailer for ONE OF THEM DAYS, I thought it might not be aimed at me. Curiosity got the better of me, I gave it a chance. I'm happy I did. It follows two best friends Dreux (Keke Palmer) and Alyssa (SZA) who are forced to come up with their rent money by the end of the day because Alyssa gave it to her leech of a f***boy Keshawn (Joshua Neal). Things get more complicated when their hunt takes them all around their neighborhood. This was a very fun movie. Not all of the jokes landed with me, but a good majority of them did. There are two things that make this movie worth seeing. The chemistry and comedic timing between Palmer and SZA were palpable. I believed they were best friends, no matter what mistakes they made (there were a lot). The second thing was the side characters. Most of them were hilarious, all of them felt relatable and surprisingly fleshed out. Detailing them would go into spoiler territory, and I don't go there. Buddy comedies are always good if the heart of it is the relationship between the two protagonists. I find it hard to believe this is SZA's first acting gig. Go see this movie, at least ONE OF THEM DAYS.

Anna Chlumsky is unable to portray a lovable character, much less a competent one. Desperate to show she is worthy of her job, Vivian begs to take on a story she has passion for. She has to fight "big mean men" to get it. She complains about Donald Trump as a reason she has to fight for this job(very random insert and felt more like a forced political jab). She's pregnant, but seems to hate this fact. She tells her husband "f*ck your sperm" at one point while he is rubbing her back. While he is good to her, she just gripes at him the entire series, refusing to help him prepare the apartment for the baby. We are forced to travel this journey with her as our tour guide, watching her make strange faces, and overact when it's not necessary, distracting us from the story at hand. Perhaps My Girl was where her journey in Hollywood should have ended...nnNow that she gets to write her dream article(after defeating Donald Trump and her bosses) it turns out she's actually very bad at her job. Three elderly coworkers end up doing a lot of the work for her(in between complaining about Donald Trump- again- why? It does nothing to propel the story forward). She does a few interviews- some in luxury environments. She even gets a designer haircut for free. She complains about the wealthy, but benefits from them each time, including a night spent in the Hamptons, and a trip to Germany complete with a translator.nnBack home, the coworkers are doing all her background work and fact checking. The women throw in random complaints of misogyny WHERE THERE IS NONE. They're taken care of by the kindest men that they easily throw under the bus and it's so strange to witness the acrobatics the writers engage in to justify it. In fact, once she finally finishes the article and it is a success, her boss is thrilled and wants to give her a bigger office. This also upsets her and she runs into the bathroom to cry about it. Nothing is good enough for the emotional roller coaster that is this character.nnVivian refuses to rest, obsessing over her article(chalking it up to having a timeline at work but in reality she is completely obsessed with Anna)and drinks tons of coffee, teetering around griping about her baby on the way. Very disappointing to all mothers on this planet, I'm sure. They do try to give her a redemption moment by showing her smiling at her newborn... but she leaves it several months later for the trip to Germany. We never see Vivian bonding with her child- it is always in a carrier or a crib or her husband is holding it. So there wasn't even a character arc with the whole "she is pregnant and angry about it but soon she'll see the fruits of her labors" trope. Just a brief smile at her baby and then her telling people she's happy to be a mom. But this is just fill and fluff and it's boring. The story would have been 10x better without the journalism hook.nnAll in all, the story of Anna Delvey was far more compelling and would have benefited from a different tour guide rather than a grumpy pregnant Vivian who is given everything on a platter and can't even do a simple job on her own.

Let's not kid ourselves here: with a script this awful, the fix was in for this turkey well before actual production started. Someone at Paramount should have taken this one behind the shed with an axe, because what we got - what we saw - is just abominable. Some of the performances in this one make Avery Brooks' Sisko look like mumblecore. Who writes the word "dwindled" into a scene at the family dinner table? Apparently some graduate of the George Lucas School of Shitty Dialogue did, and no one said, hey, uh, dude, hold up. The only real feeling this movie aroused in me, apart from lip-frothing contempt, was pity for the actors who had to try and make this turkey fly.

This film had many faces and I have to wonder if the book or the movie had an intended audience? It seems to target several American lives for example a successful Jewish family that mingles with an all American daughter whose family we never really see. The movie skillfully bring out how these rich Jews made their money by under paying employees and finally moved their factory abroad. It almost feels like a story of jealousy and how radical ideologies brought the rich middle class capitalist down with a revolution that takes them nowhere. The lovely stuttering daughter was sent off to New York to go to school and she was radicalized while she was there which sounds very similar to the woke movement in the last couple decades that has destroyed so many young people in America and encouraged them to revolt against mainstream capitalism and American traditions. Merry takes up a religion that takes her to a dark life of poverty, radical beliefs and solidarity. The final outcome of the glorious revolution but she is free now. The best part of the movie is Swede's rant to the psychologist spilling out the truth of what happened to Merry and how she was betrayed by her. Merry should have been arrested right there and taken to the authorities, but the story had to go on. I enjoyed the credits at the end accompanied by the song Moon River a favorite of my dad's.

The series had great potential to explore the fascinating origins of tourism in the Swiss Alps. The inconsistent visuals-mixing Belle √âpoque aesthetics with 1980s-inspired visuals-further detract from the immersion, making it harder to engage with the historical setting. A more balanced and authentic approach could have made the series both impactful and engaging.

And barely made it that far. What is this supposed to even be? Started like it was something from some apocalyptic fantasy/hunger games plot, that then goes into something that reminded me of the scenery from the Star Wars prequels, only to then feel like Guardians of the Galaxy with a Men In Black style alien/vulcan character. I couldn't take it anymore and stopped it at about 20 minutes in. 20 minutes of my life I'll never get back. And now I feel dumber for having watched those 20 minutes. For something alluded to as a secret organization within starfleet in the Picard series, this had a lot of potential that wasted it to be nothing more than a hodgepodge of crap.

"The Devil's Workshop," by Brasil Paralelo, disguises itself as a supernatural horror film but serves as a platform for far-right ideology. It demonizes progressivism and exalts ultraconservative values, presenting a simplistic, Manichean narrative. Characters advocating freedom and questioning dogmas are vilified, while those representing traditional morality are glorified, perpetuating stereotypes and prejudices. The film manipulates faith and fear to create paranoia and promote intolerance, silencing dissent under the guise of order. Lacking depth and nuance, it simplifies complex themes into clich√©s, reducing its artistic and intellectual credibility. Instead of fostering constructive dialogue, it polarizes and deepens divisions, using cinematic language to push a reactionary agenda. By exploiting fears of "the other," it undermines democracy and diversity, spreading hate and intolerance. Far from being just a film, it functions as a political pamphlet disguised as entertainment. In a world already fractured, such works hinder progress and harm society. Score: 1/10.

Trovato per caso qualche giorno fa... non ho Prime quindi lo visto da un amico, in due giorni me lo sono sparato tutto, non ci vuole molto, le puntate sono da massimo un'ora, alcune anche meno.nnC'√® da capire se la serie nasca cos√¨ o sia stata volutamente concentrata in questo modo ma √® troppo corta e in certi casi priva di senso narrativo...nL'inizio √® promettente sembra la scena di Skyfall mentre bond si reca bella sua vecchia villa dove √® cresciuto. Una delle scene pi√π emozionanti √® quando le due concorrenti che arriveranno pi√π in fondo hanno l'onore di salire a bordo della DB5 originale del film che ha anche gli accessori funzionanti! Una vera chicca (e che invidia).nnLa verit√† √® che solo gli appassionati possono cogliere il tutto, se non si √® visto la maggior parte dei film certe cose non si possono cogliere e si perde anche il contenuto narrativo della serie. Oltretutto per quanto Cox dica che i concorrenti siano uno spaccato dell'Inghilterra e del mondo in realt√† sono tutti cittadini inglesi, magari figli di immigrati o immigrati ma sono tutti UK.nnLa serie ripeto troppo corta per seguire appieno le ben 9 coppie che giocano che in realt√† non saranno mai 9, alcune coppie non esisteranno mai nella serie perch√© si autoeliminano al primo livello, alcune proseguono ma Amazon non ha proprio voglia di seguire la loro storia e si concentrer√† sul racconto di 4-5.nnLa sfida √® a livelli, ogni livello porta i soldi e pi√π si va avanti pi√π si guadagna. Il problema √® la narrativa e il fatto che ogni coppia affronti i livelli in maniera completamente casuale, sia a livello di difficolt√† che di location. Sfide troppo facili per alcuni, troppo complicate per altri. Anche il sistema delle domande finali √® una cazzata allucinante, mi faccio kilometri e kilometri, affronto sfide alle volte durissime per poi buttare via tutto per una domanda che magari in quel momento non so rispondere o non ho la lucidit√† di pensare. Non basta gi√† completare sfide difficili?nnLa cosa che pi√π mi da noia √® che la serie √® basata su 007 ma in realt√† non si collega in nessun modo al mondo Bond. I concorrenti non devono per forza sapere nulla dei film o dei romanzi di Fleming n√© tantomeno sembrano mai citare in nessun modo il mondo di Bond. Anche il ruolo di Cox, per quanto interessante, √® abbastanza slegato dalla serie e sembra abbastanza futile nell'economia della serie.nnIl meccanismo del gioco √® del tutto sconosciuto e fino alla fine non si riesce bene a capire del tutto perch√© √® spiegato in maniera insufficiente e non sembra neanche molto di interesse tanto tutto si riduce a trovare ste benedette valigette e vincere sempre soldi no?nnUn consiglio? Se siete appassionati o meno di 007 cambia poco, √® una serie passatempo e ve la mangiate in fretta, guardatevela ma pi√π interessanti le prime puntate che le ultime e il che √® tutto dire. Ultima cosa... ma la seconda stagione che fine avrebbe fatto?

"A Oficina do Diabo", produ√ß√£o da Brasil Paralelo, se apresenta como um filme de terror com nuances sobrenaturais, mas sob essa camada superficial, esconde-se uma obra carregada de ideologia e oportunismo, que flerta perigosamente com o reacionarismo. A trama serve como ve√≠culo para a dissemina√ß√£o de ideias que se alinham √† extrema-direita, promovendo a polariza√ß√£o e o discurso de √≥dio, t√£o nefastos √† sociedade contempor√¢nea.nnA demoniza√ß√£o do progressismo e a exalta√ß√£o de valores ultraconservadores s√£o elementos centrais na narrativa. The Netflix series The Night Agent blatantly serves as a vehicle for anti-Iran propaganda, using its plot to reinforce harmful stereotypes and vilify an entire nation. Its portrayal of Iran as a shadowy, menacing adversary perpetuates a long-standing tradition in Western media of dehumanizing Middle Eastern countries to serve political agendas.nnFrom the outset, the series wastes no time in framing Iran as a hostile force, linking it to terrorism and clandestine threats against the West. This tired trope reduces Iran to a caricature of evil, disregarding the rich history, culture, and complexities of its people. The narrative's single-minded focus on portraying Iran as an antagonist mirrors the rhetoric of Western governments, which have historically sought to justify sanctions and interventions under the guise of protecting democracy.nnThe Iranian characters are portrayed without depth or humanity. They are depicted as ruthless and morally bankrupt, existing solely as obstacles for the heroic Western protagonists to overcome. This lack of nuance not only weakens the storytelling but also reinforces xenophobic stereotypes that paint Iranians as threats to global peace. By doing so, the series dehumanizes an entire population, erasing their struggles and reducing their identity to a monolithic image of villainy.nnWorse still, The Night Agent glorifies Western intelligence agencies as righteous defenders of freedom, conveniently ignoring the historical realities of Western interference in the Middle East. For example, the series makes no mention of the 1953 coup orchestrated by the CIA and MI6 that overthrew Iran's democratically elected government, leading to decades of instability. Instead, it perpetuates a narrative where the West is always the hero, further cementing a biased worldview.nnThis series arrives at a time of heightened tensions between the West and Iran, making its propagandistic elements even more concerning. By reinforcing negative stereotypes, The Night Agent risks influencing public opinion to support aggressive policies against Iran, contributing to a climate of misunderstanding and hostility.nnIn conclusion, The Night Agent is not just a poorly executed thriller; it is a dangerous piece of propaganda. Its one-dimensional portrayal of Iran and blind allegiance to Western political narratives serve to demonize a nation and its people. Viewers must approach this series with caution, recognizing it for what it is: a deliberate attempt to distort perceptions and fuel division.

Gosh, people, this movie rates better on IMDB than Grave Encounters?! Are you nuts?! This seems to me nothing but some kind of cheap (or expensive) scam campaign. As some have rightfully mentioned here, this movie is absolutely derivative. It lacks almost everything. Unexpected twists? None. Nice cinematography? Nope. Great acting job? Nah. What else? Name anything - this movie is crap. First I gave a 3 to it, but then, when I paid attention to its current overall rating and so many blissful excited reviews, I gave it an honest 1 for being dishonest. Just rewatch Grave Encounters again, and you'll see how much scarier it was.nnSo many things in this movie have no explanation and not in that mysterious way as they should be, but just in a nonsensical way that leaves you frustrated and trying to grasp some logic. 'Just because' doesn't work. Some if not all characters are absolutely unnatural and irritating. Effects, both visual and audio, are cheap and pityful.nnMy god, somebody compares it to the Blair Witch - for everybody's sake stop doing it! They are so much different in everything, but they have the freaking same rating on IMDB!nnAre the actors believable? Not at all! When something happens and you expect some consequential twist, nothing happens next - you're just left with a feeling that you could have written the script in a better way. And then, what the hell do you need that drone for? Have you ever heard of the Chekhov's gun? I bet you haven't. You just bought a drone and wanted to have it in the movie, haven't you? Why stick your hand into some hole in the box when you can just open it? There are so many bloggers on Youtube these days who are way more natural in exploring 'haunted' places. So many cliches.nnAnd then okay, what about this: your viewers numbers on this streaming platform grow to almost a million, every character is already psyched out, and then they confess that they made something up, but now it's all real, and finally they seem to be actually panicking and not fooling around, so what would happen in the real world? Answer: they would get their million of viewers, because this builds up trust in what's happening. What happens in fact? Their numbers drop to less than 1 thousand in a blink. And then, ridiculously, the two girls that are part of the background on the streaming platform stand up and vanish. And this is where I'm 100% on the same page with the girls. I also just stood up and shot this freaking movie down. DON'T WATCH AND DON'T WASTE YOUR PRECIOUS TIME.

An interesting movie, but so historically inaccurate to ruin the movie. Henry VIII died from his leg wounds, not from being murdered. Parr was never arrested and held in the tower. Thomas Seymour never betrayed her to his brother. In short, this movie is pure fiction, not history and serves the woke agenda of a strong woman and a weak man. Kathrine Parr was an amazing, smart woman and her story would have made a wonderful tale without all the lies. It's just disappointing that Hollywood continues to distort history in order to frame historical events in terms of the woke agenda. No wonder I rarely watch historical movies anymore. Hollywood has always taken liberties with history but they didn't feel the need for outright lies to fuel an agenda.

This "documentary" is literally random images, unrelated to the Salem Witch Trials, set to a narrator paraphrasing, and seemingly much of the time, word for word reading the contents of the Wikipedia.com page on the Salem Witch Trials. Literally, when the documentary isn't word for word reading off Wikipedia, all they do is slightly change the wording and rearrange the sentence structure or placement of paragraphs of information from the Wikipedia contents. It's basically like a cheap Audible recording with random pictures on the screen, attempting to illustrate what the narrator is saying, but doing a really lazy and bad job of it. Seriously, if the creators already jacked the content, couldn't you atleast take the time to find even one illustration depicting the Salem Witch Trials? Example...when the narrator is giving details about Dorothy Good (the 4 year old daughter of Sarah Good, who was accused after her mother, and spent many months in jail as a small child), the image on screen is of 4 modern little girls playing together and dressed up like they are at a princess themed birthday party.......wtf? I get that the "documentary" (and I use that term lightly) is trying to show how a small innocent little girl looks, but it just doesn't work with the context of the subject....this misaligned and misrepresented imagery is present throughout most of the film. I don't know if "plagiarized" is the correct term to use to describe this film, so I'll just say it feels like a very lazy attempt at documentary-making for a first year at University communications major taking film production 101.....

DELETE: This is a review for the entire show, rather than just this episode, but it's worth putting here as most people if they're going to read reviews are likely to read the review for the first episode. Anyway;nn-The acting is okay, varies in quality substantially and you can kind of excuse some of the bad acting from those specific characters being trapped in a vault and so not socially adjusted.nn-The plot is driven forwards by a huge number of ridiculous coincidences, which is kind of irritating.nn-Several plots occur only because characters do not think to tell obvious things, that are not even secrets, to other characters who are already clearly suspicious. This seems to occur solely so that the plot can happen, there's never an actual reason for it.nn-The characters vary in "power" and competency fairly wild, so as to allow the plot to continue. For example one character is completely unable to deal with a kind of threat and then a couple of episodes later he gives a cool monologue about how he's always been able to deal with that kind of threat easily because of an obvious weakpoint the threat has and then singlehandedly takes down hundreds of them. And it is not as if he found out how to handle the threat in the period between the events in each episode, supposedly he has had this knowledge for decades.nn-Finally the show breaks fallout's lore, especially regarding what technology existed pre-war, and in significant ways, though I don't know if I can explain it without spoilers... Let's see if I can be vague... One of the key elements that the plot revolves around is the characters trying to acquire a "super secret technology", except that technology was an everyday thing in pre-war america in the games (and also in the show, but they just ignore it for some reason) and was one of the most significant technologies in human history and so it being a driving force for the plot doesn't make sense.

CORRECT: The Rust trilogy-spanning a decade from 2014 to 2024-is the cinematic equivalent of being stuck on a never-ending merry-go-round of missed potential. The reason I'm reviewing them as one is simple: they don't evolve. They just get longer.nnWriter-director Joe Lujan seems to think that by simply elongating his story, he'll create more tension. Spoiler: he doesn't. This trilogy borrows heavily from The Texas Chainsaw Massacre and Halloween but fails to bring anything new or interesting to the table. Instead of suspense, we get screaming women, cardboard characters, and directionless horror.nnThe plot is as predictable as a "scary" movie marathon on Halloween night. The characters scream-repeatedly-and cower in fear, but none of their actions or reactions feel remotely believable. Lujan's script is so underdeveloped, the characters are less than one-dimensional. It's the kind of horror where you're wishing for something-anything-to happen, but the film never delivers.nnCorey Taylor, NOT the frontman of Slipknot (which would've been better), improves a little by the third movie, but her performance isn't enough to save the cast from its wooden delivery. The rest of the actors fall victim to the script's lack of depth, with performances that make even the cheesiest B-movie feel Oscar-worthy.nnRust (and its sequels) tries to deliver terror but instead serves up irritation. The set pieces and "terrifying" situations fail to elicit even the slightest shiver. If you want real thrills, you're better off avoiding these three films and watching literally anything else. Rating Breakdown:nStory - 0.25 :: Direction 0.25 :: Pacing - 0.25 :: Performances - 0.25 :: Entertaining - 0.25 :::: TOTAL - 1.25/10nnThe Rust trilogy-spanning a decade from 2014 to 2024-is the cinematic equivalent of being stuck on a never-ending merry-go-round of missed potential. The reason I'm reviewing them as one is simple: they don't evolve. They just get longer.nnWriter-director Joe Lujan seems to think that by simply elongating his story, he'll create more tension. Spoiler: he doesn't. This trilogy borrows heavily from The Texas Chainsaw Massacre and Halloween but fails to bring anything new or interesting to the table. Instead of suspense, we get screaming women, cardboard characters, and directionless horror.nnThe plot is as predictable as a "scary" movie marathon on Halloween night. The characters scream-repeatedly-and cower in fear, but none of their actions or reactions feel remotely believable. Lujan's script is so underdeveloped, the characters are less than one-dimensional. It's the kind of horror where you're wishing for something-anything-to happen, but the film never delivers.nnCorey Taylor, NOT the frontman of Slipknot (which would've been better), improves a little by the third movie, but her performance isn't enough to save the cast from its wooden delivery. The rest of the actors fall victim to the script's lack of depth, with performances that make even the cheesiest B-movie feel Oscar-worthy.nnRust (and its sequels) tries to deliver terror but instead serves up irritation. The set pieces and "terrifying" situations fail to elicit even the slightest shiver. If you want real thrills, you're better off avoiding these three films and watching literally anything else.
