When a cranky old lady wants to kill your dog, you've got two options: call animal control or ride a magical cyclone out of town. Dorothy chooses the "tornado express" and lands in a world where singing munchkins and red shoes hit harder than a shot of schnapps. Honestly, this movie throws you into an LSD trip before LSD was even a thing. Respect.nnSo, we've got a lost girl, a brainless scarecrow, a lion with less courage than an unpaid intern, and a tin man who basically looks like a sentient can of soup. Together, they're off to face a witch who looks like she flopped her Comic-Con cosplay. And somehow, it works! Their friendship hits harder than that phishing email promising you a million dollars.nn"Somewhere Over the Rainbow." There, it's stuck in your head for the week-you're welcome. Every song is a sugary, kitschy burst of happiness that almost makes you forget the Munchkins look like Gremlins pre-bath. And the worst part? It works. You'll find yourself humming along, even if your soul is as dark as the Wicked Witch of the West.nnThree directors, sedated actors, and a lion in a shag carpet costume-that's how The Wizard of Oz survived its chaotic production. Yet, on screen, everything clicks. Each scene flows, each transition lands. It's proof that with a little magic (and a lot of money), you can turn a hot mess into a masterpiece.nnEver wonder why this movie is still a reference point? Because The Wizard of Oz isn't just a kids' story-it's a metaphor for life, choices, and realizing that sometimes all you need are your friends and a good pair of heels to get home. Oh, and glittery shoes? Timeless concept.nnThe Wizard of Oz is a visual and emotional slap that transcends generations. It's kitschy, it's magical, and it feels good. Not convinced? Go back to your black-and-white films, but know you're missing out on a journey that dazzles both your eyes and your heart.

First, I have to mention that this is an adaptation of a novel, and as an adaptation, it was done very well. There are a few changes to make it more accessible for a general audience, but overall, it stays true to the original story. Second, and I want to emphasize this: you need to pay attention to the entire storyline, not just the romance or the kidnapping. It's essential to understand the story of each character. Many people were disappointed with the final episode, but that's because they didn't pay enough attention. From the very first episode, it's mentioned that the male lead previously worked as a war correspondent an hostage negotiator in Argan (a fictional country)Later, he became a spokesperson, and the series begins with him addressing the kidnappings. If you follow the storyline closely, the final episode is completely coherent.nnThat said, I do have a critique about the pacing of the final episode. Things happen so quickly that, as a viewer, you don't have enough time to process and fully understand the situation. This is why the last episode might feel anticlimactic to some. I believe the series could have benefited from more episodes or additional time in the finale for better development. Nevertheless, I want to highlight the acting of the main leads. They did an amazing job. Their chemistry was incredible-you can truly feel their emotions. Their individual performances, whether crying, being angry, falling in love, or showing fear, were spot on. Every episode is engaging, leaving you wanting more and more. I really enjoyed watching it, and I found the storyline incredibly interesting.

One of the best movies i have watched. A movie to watch with family without being affected by sexual scenes. Very good comedy lines I could not stop laughing the whole time. It also has intense scenes that are captivating but not too violent. The romance in the movie is so sweet you can literally believe love exists and you want to get yourself a partner. The story of the movie is well plotted and executed with great precision. On point, with smooth and seamless transitions, the visuals are so good and the sound on point, all of this makes the movie make more sense than rather getting lost in the visuals.

It's hard to overstate my disappointment.nnHBO seldomly produces something so uninteresting and bland. Art direction, cinematography and general direction makes you wanna turn it off and put on Denis masterpieces. Script, performances and casting make you think it was a bad Amazon production.nnIt dabbles in trite phrases (what's more true, history or prophecy?), boring backstory (did you knoooow the harkonnen atreidis feude goes back over TEN THOUASAND YEARS?), and uninteresting themes and characters. It's especially boring since dune actually is a franchise about sociological storytelling, and it seems the show doesn't understand that at all. It's good enough to fill empty time I guess, but I think most people want excellence when going to dune and/or HBO, and it's not here.

What do you get if you cross A. I.: Artificial Intelligence with Rollerball? Alita: Battle Angel of course. The film moves at a snails pace and the plot is predictable to anyone who is a fan of the genre. Some good set pieces but they're not enough to lift this movie above ordinary.nnChristoph Waltz well played a nice guy version of himself. I can never really see him in another role after viewing Inglorious Basterds. Jennifer Connolly seems wasted in her role but I guess she wanted to out her villainous side. Rosa Salazar appeared to be quite lithe as Alita but, as a lot of her is CGI it's hard to tell how much is her gymnastic skills or wire work is actually her.nnThis film is along the lines of Spielberg's Ready Player One which, although not Spielberg's best beats this offering hands down. I was a huge Robert Rodriguez fan when he used ingenuity and low budgets to make films extremely entertaining films. Now he has become part of the Hollywood landscape and only occasionally makes stand out features like Sin City or Planet Terror. I gave this 6/10.

It's a shame that screenwriters take amazing source material and think they know better. It's a brilliant story that's poorly executed with the best parts of the book dumbed down for TV audiences. Simple elements like changing the lead roles has lost the character of the story.nnOn its own merit it's a pretty basic story that tries very hard to be an edgy mystery but falls flat and misses the lements needed. While the casting is good with some suprisingly solid actors the ham fisted re-writing has left them with weak dialog and a jumpy storyline that is difficult to watch. I really wanted this to work but unfortunately it's not worth the tine.

I was trying to watch something together with my 7-year-old and as soon as he saw Mr. Beast on Amazon Prime main page of course Beast games was the choice.nnMy first reaction was - shock, but after you adjust to all that overall over-the-top everything, the show could be very entertaining at moments. But the substance of the show is much more problematic. Set aside producers exploiting what's worst in people, but to see how so many adults are losing their mind and pride over slim possibility to win some money is sickening.nnAccording to the main host and his entourage the money is the GOD and to see their genuine disgust and disbelief that someone can choose loyalty over money is extremely sad.nnIf you want to see how people can be manipulative, greedy, corrupt or just plain evil, while engaging in some games, this show is for you.

Am really surprised by how much I liked this movie, given my initial impression of the trailer was that it seemed like ANOTHER "spy and assassin falls in love" story. It's not. Hit Man takes this premise and turns it on its head giving us a really compelling and interesting story that had me glued to the screen for its breezy two-ish hours run time.nnIt's an inherently interesting tale: a man, Gary (Glen Powell) is a philosophy professor who through a sequence of events, becomes an informant for the police, essentially entrapping individuals who are interested in hiring hit men to solve all manner of personal and financial problems. He meets a prospective "client" he takes a liking to, and of course, shenanigans ensue.nnHowever, it's the excellent script and performances that take this movie over the top. Look, I'm a film nerd: tell me Richard Linklater is making a movie and I will watch it. Linklater's finger prints all over this thing; it miraculously manages to retain his breezy "hang out" film style, with excellent dialog and a penchant for exploring interesting ideas so naturally.nnCase and point, when Gary and Madison (Adria Arjona) first meet, the dialog is absolutely phenomenal and it's obvious from the first lines (and not because, let's be real, Arjona is stunning) that these two have chemistry. Linklater writes dialog between men and women that basically defined how I wished my dates would go since I was a high schooler for a reason.nnBut, aside from that, the movie manages to really imbue some fascinating ideas in what is a relatively simple story (my favourite kind of writing technique). Hit Man is ultimately a meditation on morality, love, human nature, and ethical consistency; it doesn't preach or force you to feel a certain way, but cleverly reveals all of these themes to you to chew on. And, then there's the nuts and bolts of a good story with escalating stakes and twists and all of that. Maybe it was Glen Powell who kept this thing grounded (he shares the writing credit); but it certainly feels like a Linklater film with a bit more structure.nnThe performances are also fantastic. Powell is deservedly becoming one of Hollywood's most recognizable stars and he really shines here. All actors really want a movie like this; where he/she can play many characters and show off their range, but it's in the subtle distinctions between Gary and Ron (the hit man he plays) that really sold the performance for me.nnAdria Arjona is great and her chemistry with Powell is electric. I don't think this movie would be as sexy as it is without her and she manages to have a darkness to her that is utterly fascinating. I also really liked - and amazingly - found myself kind of empathizing with Austin Amelio's Jasper (the antagonist of this movie, essentially), and a lot of that has to do with his performance. Something about the man's desperate eyes made me feel bad for him.nnYeah, this thing was great. It's really unfortunate it didn't get a theatrical release, but hopefully it gets a big audience on Netflix, and we get more of these adult oriented romantic dramedies.

I dont do imdb reviews to often. But, this show is one of the best horror shows ever made. I personally think if Flanagan wanted to remake Dark Shadows he'd be the perfect one. If there was any gripe i have with this show is that it needed to be longer. A lot longer for me anyway. This show could easily have done 22 episodes if it wanted. Netflix Flanagan shows are only 1 season so if it had to only end with 1 id rather this show be longer. The thing i like the most about this flanagan show more than any other of his is the fact that he uses a monster instead of a haunted ghost house story. It also has a very 80s vibe to it because it's location setting and atmosphere. Its a different kind of vampire story as well which has more a folklore type feel to it. It is for me a 10/10 best horror show ive seen in many years. Flanagan needs to make a witch or werewolf series now and keep this going.

The Brutalist is an apt description of the last year in cinema--Brutal, Sexually Violent, devoid of love or connection--art imitating life. The MPA should have rated this movie NC-17 for the sexual violence, p*rn and nudity. Instead they have waved in more graphic sexual depictions.nnMen who make up the recently released 1 in 7 who are sexually assaulted need to know that R rated movies like this one depicts a male on male rape.nnWomen for years have had to endure these sick scenes on the big screen shown as entertainment--welcome to our ranks gentlemen.nnThankfully these films from 2024 have been flops at the box office--hitting the financiers in the pocket book will be the only way to stop it until Congress steps in. The Oscars might try and shower this one with awards but Coming to America it is not--save your money and wait for better architecture.

Loser is Winner delivers a laugh-filled ride with a heartwarming conclusion. Its message of resilience shines through every joke. This movie is a testament to the power of humor and hope. It turns every misstep into a moment of joy, leaving audiences inspired and smiling. This film celebrates life's missteps with humor and heart, proving that every failure is just a funny step toward success. Hilariously insightful, Loser is Winner captures the essence of perseverance through witty humor and unforgettable characters. The protagonist's journey is both chaotic and inspiring, turning disaster into comedy gold and leaving audiences cheering.

This was just a copied version of John Wayne's True Grit but this version was absolute garbage. The whole plot was True Grit and you could feel and sense it from the off. The only thing that was missing from the movie was the rattlesnake part at the end. If you've any sense you'll avoid this trash, it's not down voted five stars out of ten stars for a reason on here.nnWhen fierce bounty hunter Reginald Jones (Peter Dinklage) is recruited by a desperate man to track down a ruthless killer known only as Cutthroat Bill (Juliette Lewis), he rallies a band of unlikely heroes including a grave-digging ex-slave and a street-smart woman-for-hire. It is an amazing movie itbisbwhats separates a genius from the rest of us it is a work that incorporates a well known world history into two of the definitive forms of expression of the 20the century in architecture and film making becoming a commentary on both capitalism and art.sure its possible to miss the comentary on capitalism embedded in the script by corbet and mona fastvold still its also a story of immigration addiction Zionism inequty class violence and even film making the world ambitious is overused in morden critisim but very existence of the Brutalist feels like a miracle an original peace untold.

I love everything about this drama. It is one of those few Kdramas that manage to make me keep wanting for more episodes. I have to admit that the chemistry between the main leads is so over the top! They are so natural that they somehow made me wish for them to be real. I enjoy every moment in this drama from the 1st episode right till the last episode. You get to cry with Heejoo and cry even harder with Saeon! The actors worked hard potraying each individual character. Such a pity that some people chose to do this drama dirty just because of the misunderstanding they have for the final episode. Let's keep it real. This is a fiction! If you want it to be real, don't watch a drama. Watch a documentary instead. I applaud the actors and the production team for their ability to make me love this drama. Large part of it is thanks to both Yoo Yeon Seok and Chae Soo Bin for their exceptional acting. Totally recommend this drama to those who want to watch a thrilling romance with a bit of plot twist along the episodes.

I've never written an IMDb review before but I just had to for Silence after seeing it only had a 7.2. In my opinion, Silence is a top 3 Marty film and a masterpiece. It's by far his most thought provoking film, beautifully shot, has amazing performances especially from Andrew Garfield, and super well written. It didn't even feel that slow considering it is almost 3 hours. No scene felt like a waist. A profound and powerful film on religion. I truly am clueless as to how this has a 7.2. I'll insert my main review here:nA powerful film on religion. Religion brings people comfort, hope, and comradery but also brings conflict, division, pain, and oppression. This film asks an important question. Is your faith worth more than human life? Is preserving human life the greatest act of faith? If we confine ourselves into something that we aren't, our lives will become meaningless or unfulfilling. Because of this, we must always hold on to who we are under all circumstances. But is preserving who we are worth it if it means that others are harmed in the process. I, like many of the characters in this film am very conflicted with how I feel about these topics. Silence is by far Scorsese's deepest and most thought provoking film and also possibly the most beautifully shot. Andrew Garfield knocks it out of the park. He flawlessly portrays a man seeing his world come crashing down with doubts of the very thing he has dedicated his life to. Everyone in this delivers an amazing performance. Even if you are forced to hide something far away from anyone, don't let it go. Truly profound.

I love how Baek Sa Eon shows unconditional love to Hae Joo. From no communication to talking each other (thru phone) though th other party thinks that he is talking to kidnapper. I hope Chae Soo Bin and Yoo Yeon Seok will play drama together. But this time, please be a comedy. We will waiting for you, SaJu couple.

It is certainly not an easy film to watch. The music in the movie serves as a way to soothe the pain and harshness of reality, providing the female protagonist, Selma, with brief moments of solace in her sorrowful life. The Dogme 95 filming style sometimes felt uncomfortable but made me feel as though I was living Selma's life myself. The film leaves a lingering question: Was Selma right? Was the death sentence the correct decision?nnFor me, it was a sad yet reasonable ending given the circumstances and the world Selma lived in. Regarding the music, I personally prefer a more modern musical style. In conclusion, you may consider the film good or bad depending on your perspective, but it will undoubtedly linger in your mind for days among the chaos of life.

The so-so quality of much of the series was demonstrated when I got to the last episode. Possibly demob happy, I mistakenly uploaded number 26 of the first series, and it was twelve minutes before I realised I'd seen it before, just three weeks earlier.nnRobert Vaughn is fine but he has to carry it virtually single handed, apart from guest stars. Nyree Dawn Porter has played some good roles but here she is too genteel and haughty, and at the risk of sounding sexist, a teeny bit old. In Your Witness (S1 E23) she fiddles with a cigarette case while Harry fights two thugs. Good grief it's 1972 not 1872. Contrary to what is claimed in the IMDb mini bio, another Emma Peel she is certainly not. What the show needed was a groovy dolly bird, if you'll excuse my 1970s lingo. Imogen Hassall could have given Mrs Peel a run for her money. The third team member Paul (Tony Anholt) is a handsome nonentity.nnThat said, a few are worth watching:nKing Con (S1 E8). Smooth conman Anton Rodgers cons a friend of Caroline and is then conned by the team. Splendid comic turn by Vaughn as a reckless gambler.nnVocal (1 E20). Temporarily blinded, Paul is tricked by a drug dealing gang, whose boss is an accomplished mimic, convincing him he is talking to Harry. More hard edged than usual, an out of character Caroline fells the Harry imitator with a karate chop.nnBurning Bush (S2 E18). Harry imitates a drunken tramp to infiltrate a religious sect to rescue an impressionable girl who has been taken in. Good performance from Sinead Cusack, and Vaughan acts outside his usual suave persona.nnThe aforementioned Your Witness is worth a look, if only because Stephanie Beacham is in it, a rare bit of eye candy. A reviewer states that Porter had a veto on younger women appearing, I wonder how the beauteous Beacham managed to slip through.

I'm gonna miss SaJu couple, everyone did a good job. Congratulations and wish to more success for the whole cast of When The Phone Rings team.nnI'm hoping for more projects for these amazing actors. "Hitman" is a non-stop, adrenaline-fueled thrill ride that will keep you on the edge of your seat from start to finish. This slick, stylish adaptation of the popular video game series delivers on its promise of high-octane action, heart-pumping suspense, and a healthy dose of dark humor.nnTimothy Olyphant shines as Agent 47, the genetically engineered, ruthless assassin with a penchant for precision and a soft spot for... well, no one, really. His performance is perfectly balanced, bringing a sense of depth and nuance to a character that could have easily been one-dimensional.nnThe supporting cast is equally impressive, with standout performances from Dougray Scott and Olga Kurylenko. The chemistry between the leads is undeniable, and their interactions are often tense, humorous, and downright electrifying.nnThe action sequences are breathtakingly intense, with cleverly choreographed fight scenes, explosive set pieces, and a healthy dose of creative, over-the-top violence. The film's pacing is relentless, with barely a moment to catch your breath between the relentless barrage of bullets, punches, and... well, more bullets.nnVisually, the film is stunning, with a sleek, modern aesthetic that perfectly captures the dark, gritty tone of the video game series. The cinematography is crisp and clean, with a keen eye for detail that adds to the overall sense of tension and unease.nnIn short, "Hitman" is a must-see for fans of action movies, video games, or just plain old-fashioned, butt-kicking fun. Don't miss this opportunity to experience one of the most intense, thrilling rides of the year!

This movie was so wonderfully done, I cannot say enough good things about it! Not only was it true to the lore, but the historical accuracy clear down to the Romani dialect and clothing was great! The costumes were absolutely breathtaking, the scenery astounding and the cinematography was some of the best I've seen in a long time. The characters were so well done. Depp's acting was unbelievably done, she is so freaking talented I was mesmerized! Of course DaFoe was a great addition to the cast, and Skarsgard's Orlock was BRILLIANT. He was scary and gross and nasty and sexy and alluring and you hate yourself for thinking all of that lol. His voice was to die for. I saw it on Christmas, went back a couple days later, and can't wait for the third go round. This has become my favorite movie. I'm not going to go into any analysis, everyone has their own take. And being a goth who loves monsters and gothic horror, obviously I'm going to adore this as this is my jam. I hope others find it as wonderful as I did! Dear Eggers, please do more of THIS!!

I have never felt such emotions during a movie. I cried for minimum over an hour of the movie, more than I ever would when sad.nnThis movie spoke about very important topics, and realistically depicted them. I'm so happy to hear around the time this movie was released queer marriage was finally legalised. This story really broke mennThe acting was was incredible. To tie it all together, Jeff's ost "Rain Wedding" took on a completely new meaning for me. I now understand the lyrics and why they are so heartbreaking.nnI really recommend this movie. The cinematography along with the quiet music/silence was so beautiful. It felt like you were there and you personally knew the characters.nnThis movie was full of plot twists and turns. It felt like I was on a constant emotional roller-coaster.nnOverall such an important and emotional movie, with such sad but beautiful metaphors.

The biggest mistake the BBC did was let Disney take over production of The Doctor. They've taken a wonderful futuristic sci-fi show and made it a musical cartoon of it. So far, I've watched the first 3 episodes of the first season of the Disney disaster, and I'm completely disgusted. I'll finish season 1, but I don't know if I'll even continue on.nnOver the past 6 months I've watched every episode available of Doctor Who starting with the very first episode aired in 1963. I have my favorite Doctors and my least favorite and this newest version is at the top of my least favorite list.nnThe BBC should take it back or Disney should give it up and stick to animation.

Season 1 and season2 were excellent. Season3 ruined everything. It seems that writers didn't know how to untwist all story. I was enjoying this show and waited how it will end. After last series I found that this show was canceled. It would be nice, that in IMDB there was a mark, that show is canceled or unfinished. Sometimes you spent so much time and you're left in uncertainty.nnBy the way show was good. Great acting. Nice story line. If you want to see how person is changing regards environment he lives - this is the show. I'm not sure how this show is accurate with Islam religion, but...nGood luck and enjoy.

The film begins by depicting Burak's stuckness in the big city and the failures he suffers. He can't get the money for the book he translated from the publishing house, he can't get his doctoral thesis accepted by the jury members, and most importantly, he has to take care of his uncle who is a blind bookseller... The first character turning point occurs during the conversation with Altug. For the first time Burak reveals his will to start a new life. Although he has not yet finalised his decision to leave city life, his will becomes decisive for the rest of the film.nnThe plot of the film also supports the realisation of the will stated at the first character turning point of Burak. In the tension that starts with the divorce process of Altug and Ece, Ece moves to the house of Selin, Burak's ex-wife. When Altug burns the carpet in Selin's house by making it look like a burglary to intimidate her, Selin accuses her ex-husband Burak of passivity and uselessness in life. Although Burak tries to stay away from tension and negative energies, he cannot do it. Therefore, both Ece and Altug's divorce process and the tension with his uncle serve the same purpose. The first character's turning point - Burak's ability to realise his will to leave city life and start a new life. At this point, Burak cannot leave because of the responsibility of taking care of his uncle who is hanging over him like the sword of Damocles.nnAfter Serkan informs him that Altug has been kidnapped for ransom, Burak is forced to confront his past. This is the second character turning point. After the biggest trauma he has ever experienced in his life, he cannot get rid of his guilty conscience. The 'mask of cheerful recklessness, irresponsibility, the pure joy of simple living' that he tried to use in the first two acts of the film no longer works and he surrenders to a melancholic inertia. When he finds the strength to find a way out again, he drifts towards the surprise ending of the film. Despite the balance and the structure of the plot is well designed, there is still weaknesses in the main character's actions. He is too much passive to become a main character. Also the philosopcial content is somehow seems a bit eclectical. On the other hand, the film's surprise ending is really astonishing and cover those weaknesses.

Alice (Jessica Chastain) and Celine (Anne Hathaway) live a traditional life with successful husbands (Anders Danielsen Lie, Josh Charles) and children of similar ages who go to school, all of them friendly neighbors and living peaceful lives. Their happy and quiet lives are soon destroyed due to a sudden tragic event and the two mothers become suspicious of each other's actions. They begin to question the relationships they once held so dear. Guilt, suspicion and paranoia combine to unravel their sisterly bond. Sometimes it's the only thing you can trust!nnA mother's pain takes on an unimaginable dimension in this dark psychological thriller, starring Oscar winners Anne Hathaway and Jessica Chastain, which delves into the limits of friendship, hatred, fear and revenge. Set in the 1960s, with evocative settings, our protagonists, Jessica Chastain, Anne Hathaway, adequately play two housewives with two children of the same age and they all seem to live a dream life but the perfect harmony of life is suddenly broken after a tragic accident. It is a simple and direct film in which the psychological observations and the character study of the two protagonists stand out. But the plot is lightly developed and vaguely narrated without the necessary and indispensable suspense and tension required in this type of thriller, resulting in a story that seems more like the typical afternoon television movie to take a nap.nnBased on the book titled ¬®Mother's Instinct¬® ("Derri√©re la haine"), a suspense novel written by Barbara Abel, while the film is set in the 1960s, the original story is set in the 2010s; dealing with mental health, grieving the death of a loved one and the overwhelming power of a mother's love taken to the limit. The novel was already adapted to film in 2018 in the superior Franco-Belgian adaptation entitled Duelles (2018) by Olivier Masset-Depasse with Veerle Baetens and Anne Coesens, which won a record 9 Magritte Awards (out of 10 nominations) at the 2020 ¬´Magritte Du Cinema¬ª: Best Film Best Director (Olivier Masset-D√©passe) Best Leading Actress (Veerle Baetens) Best Supporting Actor (Arieh Worthalter), among others.nnPerfect Lives (2024) was professionally directed - in his debut film - by Beno√Æt Delhomme, although it is nothing out of the ordinary. Apart from the dazzling and colorful photography done by the director himself, he merely copies the French film, not adding any originality and merely recreating the events with a certain caution and without adding enough intrigue, with a rather predictable result. Delhomme is a prestigious cameraman with a long career. Benoit's first major success as a cinematographer came with his film for Vietnamese director Tran Anh Hung, "The Scent of Green Papaya," which won the Camera d'Or at the Cannes Film Festival and an Oscar nomination for Best Foreign Film. Following that success, Benoit worked with the same director again for "Cyclo." Next came "The Loss of Sexual Innocence," a bold collage of daring images shot in three weeks in three different countries. Soon after, "The Winslow Boy," a highly painterly adaptation of an Edwardian play directed by David Mamet. Then, a biopic about the scandalous Marquis de Sade during the French Revolution directed by Benoit Jacquot ("Sade"), followed by a ghost story on the streets of Taipei with revered Taiwanese director Tsai Ming Liang ("What Time Is It There?"). And an adaptation of Shakespeare's "The Merchant of Venice" with Al Pacino and an extremely stylish western shot in the Australian outback, written by Nick Cave and directed by John Hillcoat ("The Proposal"). Followed by a tragic love story between the son of a concentration camp commandant and a Jewish boy ("The Boy in the Striped Pyjamas") and a highly experimental film adapted from Oscar Wilde's "Salome" directed by Al Pacino. As well as a biopic of cosmologist and physicist Stephen Hawking directed by Oscar-winning director James Marsh and starring Eddie Redmayne, who won an Oscar for best actor for this performance ("The Theory of Everything") and continuing with "At Eternity's Gate" about the life of Vincent Van Gogh filmed entirely handheld by Benoit in Provence under the direction of painter and director Julian Schnabel, among other films. The Mother's Instinct (2024) rating: 5.5/10. The film will appeal to fans of Jessica Chastain and Anne Hathaway.

Andor is a spy thriller show created by Tony Gilroy, who also wrote Rogue One and the Bourne movies. To be honest, I never cared about a supporting character from Rogue One, but I always wanted Star Wars to focus on the repercussions of war. Andor has given me exactly that.nnAndor is a show that focuses on the rebels and their struggles during the empire era while giving an insight into how the empire deals with them. Andor shows that rebellion comes with a price, and sometimes, the line between rebels and empire can be very fragile. Andor is the first project in a decade that has made the Empire smart and scary again. I have never seen Star Wars so mature and gritty before. Andor just didn't feel like it belonged to the same universe. The plot is very well crafted, and every action of the characters has consequences.nnEveryone in this show has played their role so perfectly that I cannot praise them and the casting directors, Nina Gold (Chernobyl, Game of Thrones, The Crown) and Martin Ware (Baby Reindeer), enough.nnAll the actors have taken their work seriously. Stellan Skarsgard as Luthen, Andy Serkis as Kino Loy, Fiona Shaw as Maarva Andor, and Genevieve O'Reilly as Mon Mothma have stolen the show. They have been given a remarkable script by Tony Gilroy, and they know it. They have done their best to adapt that script on the screen.nnThe Past/Present Suite by Nicholas Britell (Succession) is a score to listen to. It's stuck in my head.nnThe budget of Andor was also very high, and it has made the best use of it, which is why it also looks costly. Production designer Luke Hull (Chernobyl) has made the environment feel grand and believable with his amazing set designs. Costume designer Michael Wilkinson (300, Watchmen, Batman vs. Superman) has put every detail in the costumes of the characters. It feels like a lot of thought and effort has been put into this show.nnOf course, it's not perfect like a 100/100 show. The pacing of Andor sometimes becomes a bit slow. It's because the show was divided into three episodes mini-arcs. So, after finishing an arc, the story starts developing another one, which makes the pacing slow. But this is much better than having amateurish writing and rushed development. Plans and conspiracies unfold slowly, piece by piece. So, you have to pay attention to what the characters are saying.nnThe actor playing Cassian Andor, Diego Luna, is not given much of a dynamic role. This is why the supporting actors outshine him a lot. Again, those actors are very good, and this is just me nitpicking.nnOverall, Andor is a show that highly surprised me. I cannot believe a show like this exists. I have never seen Star Wars so political before. It had politics integrated into the story as well as Battlestar Galactica. I am very satisfied with the direction of this show. 9/10 from me.nnAndor Season 2 is my most anticipated show of 2025 period.

Was I supposed to get some campiness out of this movie? The Dastardly Dracula mustache did it for me. I thought maybe Muttley might make a guest appearance. Though this was a remake of the oldest horror film classic, there were times when I saw tributes to many other horror masterpieces such as The Exorcist and Evil Dead. Not sure if that was intended but I saw it. Overall, the story sucked (pun intended) but it was entertaining to watch another interpretation of the Dracula classic. The final laugh I had was the bone-ass, skinny legs on Dracula at the end. Reminded me of skinny legs muscle guys at the gym. Anyway, 6 for effort, not really much in the depth category, but it was still entertaining.

This is like a conglomeration of The Maury Povich Show, Storage Wars and any bad soft core porn, with actual dna stories mixed in between. I don't know how else to describe it. It's a train wreck I can't stop watching, but the cringe is so hard I keep asking myself wtf am I watching? I would say absolutely give it a watch. But don't expect Finding Your Roots or Who Do You Think You Are? This is more like Choices, the DNA results, Canada. It seems like they are inferring they are doing some kind of research on specimens collected while it's quite obvious they are a middle man office doing business in between the lab and the lay person. I'm not sure if these are people from an actual office or just actors portraying office people. It doesn't seem to matter. The clients, when telling their stories, feel very real and at that point during the episodes it feels like it's a real ancestry show. I can't tell what generation this office is supposed to be from, but it reminds me of the 1990's, early 2000's high end art venue or spa, massage parlor maybe... It's just off. And the little off putting scenarios that aren't connected to the family stories are weird and seriously unacceptable office behavior. If you're up for a laugh and a good DNA solved family story, watch this. It's crazy wild, but somehow serious and potentially heartwarming. I dunno. It's a lot.

This was really, really weak.nnI was fan of previous Cunk installments, but just about everything that made Cunk work was missing here.nnI always felt that the joke was that it was a comedy presented as a documentary, and a documentary presented as comedy. This is a lot dumber. Adding in self-referential ads, a sex scene, a puppet show (all incredibly unfunny) threw away any sense of documentary, so all that was left was a silly comedy.nnAnd the comedy is pretty puerile. Toilet humour that a teenage boy would find tacky abounds. Philomena is still a dim-witted ignoramus, but the laughs previously came from her being innocently earnest yet confused and out of her depth with the content she's covering. Now she's actively looking for the smutty innuendo in everything and one, it doesn't work, and two, the smutty innuendo is not clever and simply infantile.nnThe experts have always been in on the joke and their deadpan responses have always been central to the show's success. Here, it feels that they aren't being deadpan. They're in on the joke, but it seems they aren't buying the lame jokes. When Cunk asks Brian Cox, "Am I wasting your time?" and he responds, "Yeah" it doesn't feeling like a witty retort but a genuine answer.nnThe show ends lamely. Cunk makes goo-goo noises for what feels like minutes, and then she gets beamed up to space.nnDiane Morgan does as well as she can with the material, and her comedic timing and expressions are about the only positives. But the writing and tone of the show is terrible, genuine laughs are scarce and the whole thing is best avoided.

Don't listen to the haters. Realize, that at the end of the day, George Lucas had always envisioned Star Wars as being a kid friendly universe. My generation expected the story to grow up with us, when it was never really designed to. That being said, Skeleton Crew is a breath of fresh air. All of the other series that are stuck in the lore have a major problem: You know how it has to end. Skeleton Crew takes a new approach, introducing characters that have nothing g to do with Luke, Leia, Ahsoka, Anakin, Maul or Mando and is completely true to its word: Goonies meets Star Wars. And. It. Is. Amazing.

This movie was super interesting especially for a film that is 2 and a half hours long. When there was 30 minutes left I thought there was still at least an hour to go. The acting by Ben Afflac was excellent the story just kept making him worse and worse until it was revealed the wife was still alive. Sadly going into the movie I already knew the twist so that wasn't as shocking to me and I knew she was alive the whole time. Still even knowing that I questioned if he did actually murder his wife. Amy was a psycho and played her role perfectly after she came home I was genuinely scared by just her facial expressions let alone her creepy dialogue. My only complaint is the ending the whole time it was setting up like her story was going to crumble beneath her but to her credit it never did. I'm not sure if it was a bad ending or just not the one I had hoped for; for example the ex boyfriend that she framed for rape could have been someone that sided with Ben Afflac story. Along with the two guys the lawyer had looking for her I thought maybe would have found something on her. Even without that I did wish the movie gave some type of resolution however it just ended. I know there isn't and won't be a second movie but it almost feels like there should be. This movie very easily could have been a 9/10 and many may argue it is. For some reason though it just didn't do it for me so I can only give it an 8. Overall good movie and highly recommended if you enjoy suspense and thrillers.

My most unforgettable kdrama ever!!! The cast the crew the production the storyline amd everthing in it is commendable.. Chae Soo Bin amd Yoo Yeon Seok portray the character and the story beautifully.. Hoping to have more kdrama from this two wonderful actor!!! All your fans worldwide are hoping to see you two be together again on a new kdrama.. I just cant move on!!!! Please hear us MBC give us more from this two amazing actor i cant imagine Soo Bin and Yoon Seok paring in another actor not now!! Its still fresh from us how they made us feel good just by watching and waiting for them in the past few months.. More more more pls!!!! KINGKONG!!!!

Brothers, daddy issues, Aaron Taylor Johnson, I can not complain. I went in to the theater thinking that it was going to be total crap. No one seems to like this movie. The trailers did not do it justice, they actually helped in me thinking that it was going to be bad. I don't know why I went to see it, my son and I just wanted to have a movie experience and eat some popcorn. We went in and within minutes we were intrigued. Action fans will like it, there was the moral battle good vs. Evil, again I say, brothers, daddy issues, I loved Calypso. I thought Kraven was a great character and would love a sequel, but because no one liked it, we probably won't get one. I'd see it again. Call me crazy, but whatever.

If people are rating this show negatively due to a certain reference to real-world events, you should know that it is a mistranslation.nnI thought the drama was really good with the many twists and turns that kept me guessing and the chemistry of the leads (particularily the performances of the male lead; the female lead character was muted in more ways than one). However, I would be lying if the show didn't kind of fall apart by the end with the disappointing ending.nnMaybe if it had two more episodes, it would have been better, but there was this whole plot in the final episode that just didn't need to be there.

I really liked much of this movie and I think it's underrated. The actors and actresses, while only a few, were good with the subject matter. I rarely watch anything Hollywood puts out because it pushes a one sided agenda so I watch foreign films. I also feel foreign films will show female genital nudity every so often, unlike Hollywood which is one sided again. Miriam Mayet is beautiful in this. She was very brave with her masturbation scene and her nudity. Something you don't see biased Hollywood doing with female's, only males. Even most foreign films are biased in that way. Bedways was taboo breaking in that way. I would watch this again and recommend anyone give it a watch.

At first I didn't have any expectations since I didn't know any of the main actors, however, as the series progressed, I always loved each and every episode. I really liked that they stuck to the original story of the webtoon, the chemistry between the main characters was so incredible that it kept you on the edge of the emotions that the protagonists presented, it was an incredible work between the producer, scriptwriter and actors. Without a doubt, a series that everyone should give themselves the opportunity to see. I hope everyone could dedicate 12 hours to enjoy this amazing drama with our Soobin and Yeonseok!!

After reading all the bad reviews I was a bit afraid of this movie and the potential disappointment. After watching the movie I realized that it wasn't ment for all.nnIt makes total sense to make a musical to go deeper in the minds and thoughts of the characters that are delusional. I'm not a big fan of musicals but here it fits perfectly with an incredibly correct purpose.nnThe way the characters are shown and how the story develops is amazingly well made. How the movie shows the real message with little details minute after minute is fantastic.nnThe end of the movie is great and the last scenes were precise.nnThe acting of both was superb. Joaquin Phoenix acting was even better than in the first movie.nnThis movie was a wake up call to many of us showing a message, with purpose in a very nice way. In the end it showed how the world is moved by symbols and not people and how the world does not understand mental illness. How now more than ever we don't go deep in understand things neither people because we need things fast, easy to understand to fulfill us.nnIt made me think that the movie was made to show how we as a society are now and that it was looking for the bad reviews as a proof of that.

At first I didn't have any expectations since I didn't know any of the main actors, however, as the series progressed, I always loved each and every episode. It was incredible to see the growth of the characters as well as the continuity of the story of the surrounding characters. I loved that at the end of the series, each of the characters was given a resolution, including those who had little time on screen. Lastly, I really liked that they stuck to the original story of the webtoon, the chemistry between the main characters was so incredible that it kept you on the edge of the emotions that the protagonists presented, it was an incredible work between the producer, scriptwriter and actors. Without a doubt, a series that everyone should give themselves the opportunity to see.

This work was ranked a respectable second in watch mojo's ranking of the worst anime of all time. It depicts the ultimate sibling love between a sister with cannibalistic desires and an older brother whose body regenerates quickly. There are few anime that deal with cannibalism. While it is commendable that the company decided to go ahead with an anime adaptation, it is clear that the budget and length of the film are insufficient. Perhaps this is because they decided that it would not be profitable to spend the budget on an anime dealing with cannibalism and make it in a 12-episode structure with 24 minutes per episode. But it's better to go a little further than to have such a cheap result. What's so terrible about it? The problems are obvious. The drawings are worse than those made by a university doujinshi club. The story is too short and disjointed. It includes a grotesque cannibal scene that makes a strangely unpleasant and uncomfortable sound. In the end, the ambition doesn't even show up in the cannibal scenes.

Jinx was incredible. Would love to see more Maestro in the future! Such a brilliant and witty character deserving a longer run. Loved the cold open introduction.nnThe Doctor and Ruby have good chemistry but I wish they'd show more of their early bonding on screen. The passage of time between their first meeting and each new episode implies the audience is missing a lot of their story together making it hard to believe they are best friends already.nnSaw a deleted scene of maestro calling out 'the next 10 min are going to be weird' or something along those lines. I really wish the line had been included in the episode because without it the musical number at the end felt out of place and way too long. Also could have done with an actual Beatles song to round out the episode.

I get that one should not always compare the original to the update/remake/continuation but in this case you cant help but to do so because it is just that... No spoilers here but once you watch the movie you will understand what its attempt was. Gladiator 1 was such an epic story and Maximus had an incredible story... one who was conscripted but was bound by honor and fought accordingly and earned the respect of both his men and the senate and now we have this new guy was could fight kinda good and is now the hero? Maximus killed quickly because he was pissed but found out how to make that into a path of winning the public and used that energy to become a hero of Rome and this guy just kinda fell into it? In the Gladiator the fights felt real and you wanted to see what the outcome was but in this, did you care? You could see what was coming miles ahead of the game.nnThis had a few big names in it and it was cool to see them but it felt more like a paycheck than an opportunity.nnI watched it, I'm happy that I did, but I can't imagine watching it for a second time... on the other hand I've seen Gladiator countless times and will be watching it again tonight!nnI refuse to tell people what to watch and what not to watch but I have a feeling that this will not be as rewatched as The Gladiator... Strength and honor!!

This story had huge potential - but in the end it was an absolute and utter waste of time and effort!nnCompletely implausible from most angles - not least of which is the police, the flite attendants, and the main male character's supposed friend!nnWhile someone may have attempted such a con, it supposed that the entire world - both laymen and professionals are completely stupid and unable to do their jobs in any credible manner!nnThe public is smarter than this, and we will NOT be accepting this kind of nonsense as credible, entertaining TV!nnSmarten up - writers/producers/actors and cable/streaming services. If you want our money and viewership!

column3: "Yamada-kun to Lv999 no Koi wo Suru" (2023)
column4: I've always seen reviews about the anime and came in with very high expectations. Initially, I admit I thought it was an overrated anime, but as the episodes went on, I could see and understand why it's so successful. The way they met and the events in Akane's life were creative, and I found the beginning very interesting. It felt a bit slow in the middle (though I acknowledge that the relationship development during that time was great). However, the start of the finale was simply amazing, and I found the ending quite satisfying. The animation is simply incredible-only Madhouse could have done it. The details, like when they look at each other and a static image reminiscent of a manga panel appears, were simple but very well done. Not to mention the crying scenes, especially in episode 12, where his friend confesses everything she loves about him, and in the final scenes between the two. Those moments evoked such strong emotions in me, despite it being rare for me to feel that kind of connection. The script is one of the best I've seen for a romantic comedy. Every character behaves like normal human beings in a relationship, which is so rare, so good, and indescribable. The slow progression of the romance was simply one of the best I've ever witnessed. Additionally, portraying the story from the female protagonist's perspective was a rare and well-executed choice. The characters were excellently written, and none of the female characters were sexualized. A pure, simple, sweet, and extremely well-crafted romance. An amazing piece of work-I now understand the positive reviews.

The last episode was a complete disaster. Honestly, what were the writers even thinking? The whole thing was such a letdown, especially with that ridiculous twist where the male lead just up and left for another country. Like, seriously? I can't even muster the energy to rant about that boring, senseless mess. The drama started off so well-episodes 1 to 10 were gold-but they completely lost the plot by episode 11. I was holding out hope for an ending that would do justice to the story and us viewers, but nope. Guess the director got lucky banking on a popular storyline and the male lead's visuals. It's clear now they don't actually know how to craft a solid drama. What a waste!

column3: Birds of Prey and the Fantabulous Emancipation of One Harley Quinn (2020)
column4: I've been watching Creature Commandos and decided I needed to watch the Suicide Squad movies. The one before Birds of Prey might as well have been a Michael Bay for the effort put into anything but special effects. Given the similar rating, I expected this to be bland trash too. But no, this was fun and enjoyable and showed more thought was put into writing than the fight scenes. Some parts absolutely cracked me up, and art design was A+. I imagine it's the butthurt man trolls who are giving this the bad ratings to put it at a 6, the types who just got their butts kicked at the amusement park.

The usual pluses apply - good banter between Bodie and Doyle, excellent action sequence - but the ending was badly rushed. A "moderate Palestinian", so-called, was to hold a secret meeting in the UK at a secret location somewhere in the countryside. Why a secure location at an airport wouldn't have worked would have meant the demise of the episode, so that option was never considered by the geniuses in the espionage services. There was an interesting twist on the "honey trap" scheme which implicated the Israeli Mossad, but that came and went and fizzled out without being at all incorporated in the plot. Everything panned out in the end but the author ran out of time so the ending was garbled. The episode had some good touches but was overall a moderate failure.

I thought this movie was overhyped, and when I first watched it (under less than ideal conditions), I found it boring during the first 30 minutes and decided not to continue.nnHowever, yesterday, I decided to give it another go from the beginning, focusing more on the film, and yes, I was a bit bored-just a little (maybe because I was rewatching it)-but as the movie progressed, I started to get excited and found it completely engaging.nnI was eager to see what surprises the next parts would bring, and it made me not want the movie to end. Although there were more dialogues, I didn't feel bored and was even very interested in their conversations. I think I really enjoyed the humor that was present as well.nnDefinitely a film I'd watch again at another time!

100% amazing. The best of 2024. I was amazed by how captivating this drama was from the very first episode. I have been a fan of Yoo Yeon Seok since Mr. Sunshine and im glad he's finally receiving the popularity that he deserves. His acting is phenomenal and the way he is able to portray his emotions is just out of this world. I look forward to future dramas of his. As a long time kdrama fan, this was the first time in a few years where I was anxiously waiting for a new episode. Yearning for anything a bts picture, a pre release, ost. Just everything about this drama is perfection. Overall acting 100. Fully recommend.

The ending was perfect. Usually in kdramas they always rush the ending and only show few minutes of scene to show that the main leads are getting a happy ending. But on this drama we got so much more. I do wish that they showed us the actual proposal rather than just the pictures but the pictures were so cute that I got inspired by it and wanna take similar pictures with my husband. Even their house looked so cute. They went from living in an almost empty apartment to living in a house that they made their home. The main leads Yoo Yeon Seok and Chae Soo Bin's chemistry was so fire that I wish they get married in real life. I am so happy they won the MBC Awards best couple and I had also voted for them. I am glad that I watched this drama when it was ongoing because waiting for new episodes every week although it was torture but I loved exchanging theories with the WTPR fandom. When the phone rings is definitely on top of my favourite kdramas. I never used to watch behind the scenes of kdramas before but for the first time I watched behind the scenes of WTPR because the main leads chemistry was still flowing in the behind the scenes.

The ending couldn't have been better. This was definitely one of the best Korean dramas I have ever watched and it kept me captivated from beginning to end. I anxiously waited week after week for the new episodes because I just new they would be better than the last each time. I would love to see more of this actor and actress together. Their chemistry was on point and made me glue my eyes to the screen whenever they had an interaction. The storyline delivered greatness as each episode unfolded. I would have loved for this drama to be longer than it was. This is the first time I rate a drama after years of watching dramas because this one was is so worth the watch and I would recommend it.

column3: Lucy Shimmers and the Prince of Peace (2020)
column4: It was able to have the effect that it needed without CGI, using context, acting, and trust in audience intuition.nnVery wholesome and touching on some heavy themes.nnI got pulled into this movie.nnI have an Uncle that died of kidney failure and a cousin that went to prison.nnI understand the seriousness of needing a kidney.nnMy cousin was very angry and serious after prison as well as feeling like the Blacksheep of the family.nnBeing able to see one's self in a new light and having hope of redemption and positive change I think invites peace. Being a great friend can do that.nnIt comes at a great price, but done with love, that's something I aspire to.nnThe actress that played Lucy, amazing.nnI found out that filming for this movie got wrapped up right when Covid 19 started.nnI think that with all the characters of this movie, it covered alot of walks of life.nnI imagine it will impact people differently just for them.

This show is complex. So I've got trouble summing it up in one review, this is attempt #4 and the one I'll post.nnPantheon attempts to approach quite challenging topics that sit as the intersection points of society, culture, tech and (im)mortality. They have been covered in other works of fiction and games, something that other reviews already detailed.nnThe way it weaves IT stuff and tech into the plot is frequent, and while isn't always correct it is doing a better job than your average hollywood movie which would get it wrong 100% of the time. Props for that. It does pile a more heavy load of multiverse concepts near the end of Season 2 that may be a bit much for viewers who have not yet had exposure to the subject matter. You will have to suspend a good amount of disbelief to prevent it from looking like a fairy tale.nnWhat the reviews with low scores overlook is that this series may very well be the first exposure of a new audience to the whole topic of transhumanism and uploading and virtual/simulated reality.nnSo to them, this IS new. That explains the 10 star ratings. And if this makes people interested in diving deeper into these topics, then that is great and perhaps the best outcome one could ever hope for.nnThere are some negatives and they kept me from checking it out sooner.nnThere is a main plot and it does have cohesion. Yet, in most episodes it feels like another writer went over the script and then thinned out the plot advances with additional emotional scenes, or by injecting a lot of anger, outrage and rude behavior that feels unnatural and out of place. Forced. Action for the sake of action.nnThe main character females in this series are often written to be abnormally hostile, pushy, empowered and douchey in a lot of scenes. While the male characters are very fond of using guns in an insane way. Both types of behavior are tolerated by other characters who then forget all about it a minute later. This is especially true for Season 1, as well as the start of Season 2. It does get significantly better after that point.nnIf you do not really care about the emotional dramatic bits you can very generously skip through them. Especially the first episodes of Season 1 have a lot of filler material that's irrelevant, so as long as you take note of the key plot developments you'll be able to follow along easily. The pace does pick up by the middle of the season.nnSeason 2 begins quite decent, and the writing gets better steadily and peaks around the second third. Towards the end there is good pacing and the story gains complexity that elevate the show. There are also less instances pointless drama, making it instead situationally appropriate, and more time is given to secondary characters who are interesting and actually enrich the plot with true variety of perspectives, without a political agenda. It is the real life situations with the cast from the first Season that often remain annoying. Skipping through them helps. The show definitely grows and explores more exotic avenues and recursive topics, with a load of philosophical themes towards the end of the second season.nnIf you can manage to hang on and watch through Season 1, you'll be rewarded with an interesting show that'll feel like it is worth your time. It isn't perfect, but it is interesting and gives some food for thought. That's pretty good.

Taylor Sheridan has made good tv shows in Yellowstone and the spin offs but this is very wide of the mark. The way he's written the relationship of Billy Bob Thornton and his daughter's character (who is supposed to be 17 btw) is downright disturbing. Having her run around the house in her underwear and calling him 'daddy' is just gross, along with the way she speaks to him about her sexual relationships to him is absolutely ridiculous, you will not find one father/daughter relationship like that yet his writing and directing (first 2 episodes) are just so weird and like it's his own creepy sexual fantasy. The same goes for the wife character. Just pure and utter sexualisation with next to zero substance and depth. Billy Bob and Jon Hamm carry the show because they have the talent to do so. The show has good action set pieces but very little more than that.

The World is not Enough (1999).nnPierce Brosna's best film as the worst James Bond, remembered for ridiculous surreal scenes especially in Goldeneye (1995),nnThe pretty Sophie Marceu looks like Isabelle Adjani who should have been a Bond girl. Renard looked like Donald Pleasence as Blomfeld from You Only Live Twice (1967). Maria Grazia Cucinotta very sexy.nnAll the good guys are hateful here as Dr Christmas Jones, "M" the hateful dwarf grandmother, 007 a walking joke already seen says he hates killing unarmed people in cold blood but he does it twice the last time to a woman. At the end maybe the worst of all "R" John Cleecy as he was not funny.nnI prefer the villains Renard anarchist but he seems to follow at least some ideology, he could not feel physical things but he was too sentimental or passionate. The villain Elektra King is a manipulative, vengeful, she was mentally a teen, rich tantrum-laden who thought she could get away with anything.nnHere James Bond looks like a cheated cuckold castrated by a woman. As always, 007 movies were propaganda about British imperialism, colonialism, globalization, the white british savior, etc.nnBond killing in cold blood leaves him in a bad light. Denise Richards was very obvious about her rhinoplasty and her terrible actress. The worst Bond girl was Dr. Christmas Jones. She wears an outfit like Lara Croft.nnThe best scene is when Renard finds out about Elektra's death, the worst quote in the film is when the idiot Bond says "she is ready for you", at least Renard smiled showing he doesn't fear death and without Elektra alive causing explotion didn't matter anymore. The worst scene was the last scene of Bond sleeping with Jones.

I don't like watching an ongoing drama, I usually wait for it to be completely finished b4 I start binge watching. But this one makes me patiently wait for Fridays and Saturdays.nnThis Kdrama deserves 10/10 rating. My First time giving a drama a review because it deserves to be watched. The every actors in this drama needs to be recognized, they made a great portrayal of their character, specifically the main leads.nnEVERY episodes has its plot twist!!! I'm here rewatching it again, it would take a while for me to start a new Kdrama to watch. I just can't get enough of it.nnKudos to Yoo Yeon Seok and Chae Soo Bin for great portrayal and their overflowing Chemistry.

Another Korean series without any content, spoiled and luxurious scenes, which only tried to attract the audience by using popular young actors and luxurious show-offs.nnThis drama could have easily ended in 12 episodes, but by stretching and tiring the audience, the few charms of the actors' good acting are also wasted.nnExaggeration, an unrealistic and repetitive story, such as the hotel owner who drives 2-3 hours from his workplace in Seoul every day to reach the coastal city where his favorite girl lives, and when he arrives, it's as if he didn't drive 3 hours after a working day,nor the face make ups and hairstyles that are so fresh and well after waking up like no one has slept and the same boring privatising the amusement park late at night and getting ice cream and snacks from the park where all its employees have been dismissed, .......If I wanted to continue, I could write hundreds of lines.nnI give this drama a score of 6 out of 10, and unfortunately, I dare say that the plot was very weak and not original.

I'm a silent reader of IMDB ratings since years, but i just had to create this account to talk about the ending of rhis movie. It makes no sense whatsoever. It ist explained in any way. Its sth that makes me slightly angry tbh. Whats the case here? Did they run ist of time, ideas or Motivation?nnThe movie was decente. Nothing special but ok. An Netflix-Style Story that no one cares and you will forget after 1 day. But stil nice shots, good acting (realy enjoyed Alex) and entertainment for a boring tuesday night (not enough for a friday night). Stil confused about the killed and pregnant main actress that survived (?) hide herself for four years (?) and than casually meets Alex to show her her kid (?) She is now chillin with in the mountains (?).

From beginning to end excellent writing, storyline and acting di a great job at bringing awareness to physical/verbal abuse hoping it will encourage the person to get out while they can and seek help. The abuser should seek help for drinking/drugs/battery inflicted on his/her loved ones.nnOnce the victim has recognized and find strength to lave they should seek assistance, treatment as well. Seek a safe place for her and her children.nnWhile many may not agree, the children or child should also be afforded counseling too, as this will be an incident or incidents that will remain throughout their lifetime.

The writers wanted to be so clever with Hugh Grant's 'mind-opener' monologue about religion in the first half of the movie, but they failed terribly. Sure, they propose a few basic thoughts and facts about religion that might be new and interesting for someone who didn't manage to tackle elementary education and/or for those who were cursed to grow up (?) on Marvel movies and similar empty, infantile, dull garbage.nnFirst of all, Mr. Reed fails to distinguish faith, religion and church. Although these concepts relate to each other, they are fundamentally different at their cores. Either the authors don't understand this simple fact themselves or they don't bother spending more time with the topic, to favor cliche horror themes and scenes later instead. If you don't know what you are talking about, simply don't do it.nnSecond, iterations with regards to the development of religions don't necessarily mean that all religions talk about the same thing. Sure, Judaism, Christianity and Islam share a great deal of ideas, but they are very different in several aspects, especially regarding their 'target audience' and the nature of God. Mr. Reed satisfies himself by telling the poor girls that all religions are the same, just in newer and maybe poorer wrapping. Lazy.nnI also have to mention the 'brilliant' reasoning why so few people follow Judaism - because of the Holocaust. Please, no.nnI could go on, but you get the point. It's a 5/10, since the movie has some merits and Hugh Grant is brilliant, as always. I would recommend to spare your time and money though.nnIf you are looking for a truly intellectual piece about religion, go watch A Serious Man by the Coen brothers. It's a lot of fun too.

A complete emotional experience drama with a lot of spice as it is a thriller romance. Yes, it has some flaws but the overall production and storyline is on point and made me hook from start to finish. As someone who watch hundreds of kdrama, this one will always be easily included in my top 5 best drama of all time. The main actors claimed their roles wholeheartly and gave exceptional chemistry I've been missing for a long time. Yoo Yeon Seok and Chae Soo Bin are treasures in the sea of korean actors. Hope to see them again in a new project. Fridays and Saturdays will never be the same without SaJu couple.

Please Netflix don't give him another special ffs. This one was terrible, 'stale jokes and sweaty old man tits' is the best description I can give this special. And there was nothing special about, just a regular waste of your time. To summarize: redundant jokes, homophobic (don't get me wrong, I love a good gay joke. When done correctly they can be hilarious. But this was just pure cringe). It's sad to see this old man sweating on stage and messing up every bad 'joke' he'd try to tell. Like a good MMA fighter, Joe should have stopped in his prime. Now it's just sad, like b.j. Penn. Hard to watch.

I noticed In the reviews section that there were only 22 ratings from Pakistan out of the 445 or so. After watching this movie, contemplating over it and checking the cast\crew section I realized why that is so. All the writers and almost all the producers are not Pakistani aside from the main producer who is Pakistani-Canadian and the director who is also Pakistan-Canadian, and I suspect is put there by the westerners as the face of this project. A story about Pakistan forged by and portrayed through the lens of people who are effectively all non Pakistani. No wonder it came out so wrong.nnThe Film seeks to depict the challenges in a fatherless and underprivileged young girls life in Pakistan and completely misses the mark. The story and the characters are largely divorced from the ground realities of Pakistan, with its poorly written characters and a hollow storyline aside from off course the obvious attempt throughout this movie by the writers to depict Pakistani man as evil personified and the poor woman being subjected to their will as helpless, frail and abandoned by the law and culture at large. This is nothing short of what I would expect what your typical ill informed CNN and FOX watching westerner would think. From its misrepresentation of a culture, Misandry, Inconsistent and unlikeable characters, lack of depth, bad dialogues and poor choice of filming locations, this movie misses the mark by allot.nnMisandry in the Movie: The leading roles were played by women in this movie. All the males were cast in supporting roles. All of the main male characters were cast in a negatives role and a substantial amount of all the in and out male characters were also assigned a negative role. To prove this thesis I present to you examples of 7 male portrayals. 3 of the Leading male characters were depicted as; A sleazy, charmer and seducer boyfriend, An opportunist, scheming and unsympathetic uncle and A Shady Rapist rickshaw driver. 4 negative fleeting roles included; A domestic abuser father, A public masturbator, a vicious attacker (Brick thrower) and a uncooperative police official.nnThe first half of the story Involved depiction of pre marital relationships which is not common within the context of Pakistan and especially not within the context of a below middle class family as is shown here. In fact such relationships are extremely frowned upon and this could be another major reason why the film performed abysmally, because it failed to connect with the wider Pakistan audiences. When you hate on a people however subtly or otherwise and you misrepresent them in the way it is done in this movie, you should not be surprised if they don't show up and don't recommend your content to the next person.nnThe filming locations were also not attractive. Karachi has allot to offer. Could have chosen a better neighbourhood to shoot the film. Why choose a literal slum adjacent? What is this obsession of westerners with showing slums and dilapidated infrastructure in Pakistan and India?nnThere were a few critical mistranslations in the subtitles, that could have further caused the na√Øve viewers relying only on the translations to be appalled for no reason.. The lead character in one instance tried to say that wearing a hijab was at first a habit but as time went on became a form of worship, but it was mistranslate to the following "First it was a habit, then became my duty". Duty being the operative word here, suggesting that it might have been forced. Additionally when someone breaks your cars window with a damn brick, ones first instinct based on the given information would be to think that its a robbery attempt or perhaps an attempt to kill, not what is hinted at in the movie by this unlikeable white saviour indoctrinated British Pakistani character. Further there was mention of sharia by the lawyer which seemed wildly irrelevant given that the problem at hand was a flawed Pakistani judicial system not a flawed religious law as was erroneously suggested, despite the fact that the rights of the women in Islam are protected.nnAll in all this Western funded film showed Pakistan and especially Karachi in a very poor light. This film is a offense against its people.

"The Witches" (2020) starring Anne Hathaway is a darkly whimsical reimagining of Roald Dahl's classic novel, but it's not without its flaws.nnHathaway's portrayal of the Grand High Witch is absolutely mesmerizing - she delivers a performance that is both wildly eccentric and chilling, embodying the villainous character with a perfect balance of humor and menace. Her dramatic physical transformation, coupled with a voice that oozes malevolence, makes her an unforgettable figure, leaving a lasting impression on the audience.nnThe film's visual design is a standout, featuring imaginative CGI that brings the world of witches to life in striking, often unsettling ways. The settings are beautifully crafted, with vibrant, exaggerated colors and dark, eerie undertones that capture the essence of Dahl's original story. While the visual effects are bold and creative, at times they veer too far into the surreal, making the experience feel more cartoonish than necessary for the darker themes the film tries to explore.nnThe story, while faithful to its source material, at times feels rushed. The pacing in some areas falters, and the transition between key moments doesn't always flow smoothly. There's an emotional disconnect in places that makes it difficult to fully engage with the characters, despite the effort from the talented cast.nnHowever, there are moments of pure magic within the film. The transformation scenes, in particular, are expertly executed, creating a sense of awe and terror. The combination of dark humor and horror, mixed with a touch of heartwarming family sentiment, provides an enjoyable experience overall.nn"The Witches" is certainly a feast for the eyes and a joy for fans of the fantastical, but it's not quite as enchanting as it could have been. With a stronger emotional core and a more consistent pace, it could have been a true standout. Still, it's an entertaining ride, and Anne Hathaway's performance alone is worth the watch. It earns a solid 7 stars for its creativity, visual flair, and captivating villainy.

Every so often comes a film with imdb ratings that do not match the film.nnThis is one of them.nnThis is a 5.2 film at BEST..nJust because it's based on a true story doesn't make it a good film.nnThis has zero suspense, zero payoff.nnJust boring all the way through with the usual writing on the screen at the end for all generic "true story movies"nnSave yourself the time and pick that other film you were of thinking of watching tonight coz this one just isn't good and you'll be pissed off when you've wasted all your valuable down time on this extremely mediocre pile of doo doo....nn4/10 defo do not recomend.

The Masked Man (TMM) stands out as a thrilling and complex drama that delves deep into human emotions, morality, and survival in a hostile world. Spanning multiple seasons, the show combines gripping storytelling, multi-dimensional characters, and shocking twists to create a narrative that leaves a lasting impression on its audience. Its ability to balance high-stakes action with emotionally resonant moments is what makes TMM a standout show and a favorite among fans of the genre.nnAt its core, The Masked Man is a story of survival and the lengths people will go to protect themselves and their loved ones. The titular masked man serves as both a menacing antagonist and a symbol of the chaos that pervades the world of the show. From the very first season, viewers are drawn into a world where no one is safe, and every decision comes with dire consequences. This unpredictability keeps audiences on edge, making each episode a must-watch. The show's pacing is masterful, with moments of calm juxtaposed against sudden bursts of violence, creating a rhythm that keeps viewers engaged from start to finish.nnThe characters are another reason why TMM is so highly regarded. The show introduces a diverse cast, each with their own unique backstories, motivations, and struggles. Characters like Jake Jarson, Penny Jarson, Sarah, Otis Mayberry, and the enigmatic masked man bring depth and complexity to the narrative. They are flawed and human, making them relatable even in their darkest moments. The show explores themes of loss, revenge, and redemption through these characters, allowing audiences to connect with their journeys on a personal level. For instance, Jake's transformation from a protective father figure to a man broken by tragedy is both heartbreaking and compelling, while Penny's resilience in the face of unimaginable loss inspires hope amidst the darkness.nnOne of TMM's strengths lies in its ability to craft memorable and emotionally impactful moments. From shocking deaths like Sidney's in Season 4, Episode 13, to powerful confrontations between characters, the show consistently delivers scenes that linger in the minds of viewers. These moments are often accompanied by expertly crafted dialogue, such as Sarah's iconic line, "Try me, bitch," which showcases the characters' strength and defiance in the face of danger. The writers' willingness to take risks and push the boundaries of traditional storytelling elevates TMM above other shows in the genre.nnThe show's ability to blend different tones and genres also contributes to its appeal. While primarily a survival drama, TMM incorporates elements of horror, mystery, and even moments of dark humor. The masked man himself is a terrifying figure, embodying the fear of the unknown, but the show also delves into the psychological toll of living in a world plagued by violence and betrayal. This combination of external and internal conflicts adds depth to the story, making it more than just a series about survival.nnVisually, TMM is stunning, with its use of atmospheric settings and cinematography enhancing the mood of the show. The forest sequences, abandoned towns, and tense nighttime confrontations create a sense of isolation and dread that perfectly complements the narrative.
