This is enough to help Max restore his former emotion-free composure and the film ends.nnPersonally, I'd be more interested to see a film about Max trying to muster the courage to tell his daughter how much he cares about her, and digging through his family's past but for that, we may have to wait until his younger daughter is ready to move out.

I have never written a review for a movie before but this movie was regrettably the worst thing I've ever seen and that's saying a lot. I wish this thing could get banned just for how dumb it is. That's an hour and 40 minutes of my life I'll never get back. The characters, the plot, and the music were well below subpar and even the acting was horrendous. If you do one thing right in your life- it would be to not watch this and maybe by not watching it this will end up lost in the archives never to see the light of day again. For me to get on IMDB to even write a review for a movie because of how dumb it was is a huge statement. End rant.

I can't get enough of this at all. I've not laughed out loud this much for ages. Really well written, heartfelt, and real. I love the characters, the token lesbian, the fag hag, the drag mother, the rancid queen and the twink - some may say clich√© but every group has these on the scene. Very relatable as a gay man that's grown up.on the NE scene and experienced the odd night in the 'boro. Only wish Enpire had been a gay club back then! Please renew this for another ten series, I can't wait for the next installment. Kudos to Dunning for thr writing and all the cast for the acting, what a rare and precious find.

Of course, the car is only a material extension of the user and that is why we have here a typological handful of frivolous drivers whose fateful fate at the end of the short could very well resemble reality, in the sense that sooner or later they coincide in an accident. Or neurasthenic friction of this nature; one carrying a quadrangular type display vehicle with the parrot cage, the dog and wearing impeccable hippie clothing, the other unhealthily concerned with the personal signage of road traffic to the point of checking the knobs of the gasoline pump and the other drivers for nonsense and trifles; one more, perhaps the worst, the deranged one who corners other motorists to feel adrenaline, splashes mud puddles on pedestrians and his best proof of being clinically disturbed is watching him tear off the wings of butterflies, poof. Duvivier has already dealt with the corners of dementia before in "Autoportrait d'un schizophr√®ne." IN short, everyone will agree in the end on the traffic mishap that no one expects but that no one at some point in their life can avoid.

I seldom write reviews on movies because I am just not qualified to do so. Then, along comes this documentary exposing the lengths of abuse of power that people in positions of power will go to in order to protect their own interests. I found this movie riveting, totally absorbing my interest in the almost 50 minutes of its course. It is an emotional film and leaves you with a sense of satisfaction and joy to see the outcome. No amount of apology or compensation can ever do justice to the small business people involved and my heart goes to everyone treated so unfairly. Kudos to the people behind the making of the film. One of the best I have seen in a long time.

Jonathan Glazer's The Zone of Interest is a haunting and unflinching portrayal of the banality of evil. Set against the backdrop of Auschwitz, the film chillingly juxtaposes the idyllic domestic life of an SS officer's family with the horrors of the Holocaust, just beyond the walls of their garden. What makes this film so unsettling is its refusal to engage directly with the atrocities taking place; instead, it presents the family's deliberate indifference to the suffering happening mere yards away from their idyllic home.nnThe cold detachment of the H√∂ss family is the emotional core of the film. Glazer masterfully conveys their apathy by focusing on their everyday lives-mundane routines, garden parties, and moments of familial affection-while deliberately avoiding direct depictions of the concentration camp. This stark contrast forces the audience to confront the moral void at the heart of the family's existence. The chilling realization is not only that they are complicit, but that they have constructed a world where the suffering of others is entirely irrelevant to their own lives.nnOne of the most striking elements of The Zone of Interest is its sound design, which plays a crucial role in creating an atmosphere of dread. While the visuals often linger on serene domestic scenes, the audio tells an entirely different story. The muffled screams, distant gunshots, and eerie industrial hum of the camp are ever-present, a constant reminder of the horrors unfolding just beyond the wall. It's a testament to Glazer's skill that these sounds, often subtle and in the background, are more terrifying than any graphic depiction could have been.nnThe sound design doesn't let the audience forget the reality of what's happening, even if the characters in the film seem to have perfected the art of tuning it out. This dissonance is profoundly disturbing, especially when one considers the historical reality. Knowing that such atrocities actually happened-and that people lived their lives in willful ignorance so close to the epicenter of such suffering-is a chilling thought. The film confronts viewers with an uncomfortable truth: the capacity for humans to normalize the unthinkable.nnWhat makes The Zone of Interest even more powerful is how its themes resonate in the present day. As I watched the H√∂ss family carry on with their lives, seemingly unbothered by the horrors just beyond their garden, I couldn't help but draw parallels to modern conflicts. In 2024, the ongoing crisis in Palestine mirrors some of these unsettling dynamics. Entire communities are being devastated, and yet there are people who live nearby, perhaps not physically but ideologically, who choose not to see, hear, or acknowledge the suffering. This is not just a historical issue-it's a human one, and Glazer's film serves as a stark reminder of how easy it is to turn a blind eye to atrocities when they are happening to someone else.nnThe performances in The Zone of Interest are deliberately understated, reflecting the film's clinical and detached tone. Sandra H√ºller, in particular, delivers a chilling performance as Hedwig H√∂ss, the wife of the Auschwitz commandant. Her character's preoccupation with maintaining her home and garden, while ignoring the unspeakable acts occurring just beyond the wall, is both infuriating and deeply unsettling. H√ºller's ability to convey this emotional numbness without ever appearing overtly villainous is a testament to her skill as an actress.nnUltimately, The Zone of Interest is not an easy watch, nor is it meant to be. It is a film that demands introspection and forces the viewer to confront the uncomfortable realities of human nature. By refusing to show the atrocities directly and instead focusing on those who ignored them, Glazer challenges us to think about our own complicity in the suffering of others, whether through action or inaction.nnIn a world where similar horrors continue to unfold, The Zone of Interest is a vital, if unsettling, reminder of the consequences of indifference. Its cold, detached perspective and harrowing sound design make it one of the most impactful films of recent years-a haunting reflection of both past and present.

Ignore all the other reviews. This Umjolo series is soooo good!!! I watched all of them the day they came out. I hope more will be released. Yes, the sex scenes are a bit much but that doesn't mean the entire movie is not worth watching. Grow up lol ! I love how they are all connected in small ways. So creative. South African movies are the best. I also love that we get to see different parts of the county. I love how the characters speak both Zulu and English. It is very fun to listen to. The movie is full of culture too. I love that movies from the continent of Africa are available for us to watch in the states. I look forward to more coming out. This body of work is nothing short of amazing! Keep up the excellent work team!

This is a Masterpiece of a drama. For a long time I was not "into" a drama like this drama. I bingewatchen it last Saturday. I was very eager to watch it and was counting the days that the last episode was shown.nnFor the people who are complaining about the Argan war place...did not read the webtoon. It is very difficult to put all the important things from the webtoon in a drama and the writers did their best and I'm glad with it.nnThe chemistry between the ML are WOW. The kisses and the emotions were on point.nnShout out for the whole cast of WTPR. You all did an AMAZING job. For me will be this drama for a long time in mine heart!

Story- Complex but flawednThe story followed a two childhood sweetheart but separated which later met when the became young adult but their fate had different plans for them leaving behind a devotional love story for us.nnThe story was complex or better Pseudo complex due it's vast characters & gripping screenplay. But it had a major flaw of devdas's character & his mentality. He first rejected paro's love but later regreted on it.nnScreenplay- ExceptionalnThe screenplay was so good that it binds you to your seat for three hours. The love story was presented in most intense form which seemed so devotional, not just love story but the way writer showed the family dynamics was so hard hitting which gripped us & thus supported the main story which was going on. The way writer wrote the divine love of devdas & paro that even chandramukhi was not able to seduce him.nnCharacters- SuperbnThe character build up was so good. All characters had a meaning & importance in the screenplay of the film. All had a motive & many shades. Even with so many characters the writer was successful in showing the emotions & shades of all.nnDevdas Mukherjee- He loved paro so much but had to leave her due to family pressure, which ultimately lead to his self destructive phase. In whole film he was showed a failed lover, son & human being inspite always being honest.nnParvati "Paro" Chaudhary- She was childhood sweetheart of devdas. She was shown a devotional lover of devdas who always hoped better for devdas. She was shown understanding, caring as well as self respect person.nnChandramukhi- She was sex worker who fall in love with devdas inspite that he insulated her many times even hated her initially. But due her caring nature devdas also fall for her but as he was still not able to move on from paro thus never took her love seriously.nnChunnilal- He was a fun loving person who didn't had a family thus was married to alcohol and music. He always speaks in poetic manner. He loved devdas from his heart.nnSumitra Chakraborty- She was mother of paro who was shown a emotional person. She was only one who understood the love of devdas & paro. She wanted devdas to marry paro.nnKaushalya Mukherjee- She was mother of devdas. A lady with lots of ego but also love for his son. She was influenced in negative manner by her daughter in law.nnKumud- Her character was shown most evil in the film. She had influenced kaushalya in negative manner which ultimately destroyed the life of devdas. She was jealous & greedy but very intelligent people.nnKalibabu- The son in law of paro who was of same age of paro. He was shown a Pervert.nnVijayendra Ghatge- Ghe husband of paro who was significantly elder to her. He was shown a conservative husband.nnRest all characters supported the story.nnPerformances- CommendablenShah Rukh Khan- He delivered a career defining performance. His expressions & dialogue delivery was hard hitting.nnAishwarya rai- Only one word to describe her is gracious. Her performance was so gracious, so beautiful & so charming. Her expression were also superb. Undoubtedly one of the most gracious performance of indian cinema.nnMadhuri dixit- She although had a secondary role in the story but just nailed her part. Her dialogue delivery & dance moves were exceptional.nnKirron kher- Superb dialogue delivery.nnJackie- Good performance. Will make you fall in love for his character.nnAnanya khare- The surprise performance of the film. She nailed in her character. She had a small role but made a huge impact on the movie. Her dialogue delivery will won your heart.nnMilind Gunaji- As Kalibabu did a good support in the story.nnTiku talsania- He also did his character well.nnDirection- ExtraordinarynThe director was successful in showing all shades of the characters in most Magnum way. The way some scenes & characters were presented which conveyed every emotion & message without unnecessary drama or over the top dialogues. Sanjay leela bhansali truly made indian cinema proud. Till now his best work. Truly a perfectionist.nnCinematography- SuperbnThe cinematography made ever scene lavish & film magnum opus.nnMusic and BGM- GoodnThe songs by ismail darbar again won heart after hum dil de chuke sanam. Truly melodic songs although not all.nnThe BGM made scenes more impactful.nnProduction value- GroundbreakingnThe sets, costumes & lighting was truly great & well researched. Some much of focus & hardwork must have done on sets & costume.nnDialogues- RemarkablenThe dialogues were written superb which made every situation impactful in the film.nnEditing- SharpnEvery scenes were placed so perfectly which will play with your emotions.nnIdeology- The writer in this film wanted to show a devotional love story married by high octane family dynamics, emotions & misery. The writer highlighted some more sensitive topics like family politics, jealousy, taboo about sex workers, cast system, arrange marriage etc. This all topics made the movie more interesting. The writer wanted to convey that love is more than sex & sometimes love is self destructive.nnFinal verdict- The film is a must one time watch especially for love story loving audience. The gripping screenplay, superb character build up, lavish sets & melodic songs along with exceptional performances deserves your three hours. But again lots of people will not connect with its core story. The story made this film a one time watch.nn1- Performancesn1- Directionn1- Screenplayn1- Production value, sets & costumesn0.25- Storyn0.5- Song & BGMn1- Charactersn0.75- Dialoguesn0.5- Editingn0.5- Cinematography.

¬°Viva Franco! ¬°Viva Franco! ¬°Viva Franco! ¬°Viva Franco!nnMore trite produced by certain people to brainwash the masses. This film and all in it belong buried in the deepest and darkest pit that can be found. Don't waste your time watching this actual propeganda film.nnThe plot, if such dribble can be called as such, concerns a useless communist from Spain doing what communists do best: running away from his home country and becoming a parasite in a neighboring one. A parasite who robs banks, larping as a contemporary Robin hood.nnIf you have a can of paint in your home, open it and dump it on the ground. Watching it dry is a better use of your time than this nonsense.nn¬°Viva Franco! ¬°Viva Franco! ¬°Viva Franco! ¬°Viva Franco!

Great art this film ain't, but it actually improves as it goes along. I could forgive any viewer for giving up in the first half hour; the beginning of the film really should have been edited down to about five minutes and in this section De Niro gives possibly the weakest performance of his entire career. Then, however, a moderately funny scene in the retirement home rescues the whole thing. Once the plot finally gets to the point where they start producing their woke Western (a movie which, by definition, they never intend to finish) it does at last become reasonably watchable and De Niro ups his game considerably though is consistently outshone by Jones. Each successive near-brush with death, whether for the intended victim, the perpetrator or innocent bystander, elicits at least a mild chuckle and it's reasonably entertaining in the final analysis. This film could benefit from re-edit; a slightly shorter version might merit the wider release it has apparently missed thus far.

The Fog was the first horror I watched fully, when probably younger than I should have.nnPerhaps there's some nostalgia, but it's still an all time favourite now.nnLess than two years after the sublime Halloween, John Carpenter came out with another cracker here.nnTom Atkins does his usual good job in these sort of films, and with the fine Adrienne Barbeau as the calm voice on the radio.nnLook out for weather man Dan, played by Charles Cyphers of Halloween fame.nnThe suspense builds perfectly, and the artistic shots are wonderful and all add to the creepy atmosphere.nnThe excellent score only adds to it, and you'll remember it forever.nnThere is some mild gore, but nothing serious.nnMemorable one this...Simply superb.

This is a puff piece promo not a documentary. Just a bunch of OF stars talking about how great OF is/was.nnFirst off I am completely uninterested in the producers on OF. I was hoping for a behind the scenes look at the mechanics, customer exploitation and some stories about the support staff for these "content producers". I was hoping for more of the business side, there was some but it was mostly anecdotal with no interviews other than the OF stars.nnAbsolutely nothing about the consumers, other than some pundits vaguely talking collectively about them. There is nothing about the psychology, motivations, or dangers to/from the consumers.nn1/2 of the movie revolves around the porn industry, and how difficult it is to make money in that industry and how they make more money on OF.

Lashana Lynch destroyed the entire TV series. Disappointing acting.....a total disaster.nnThe series is interesting, the story is ok, but the performance of the detective actress is a complete embarrassment..in my opinion it ruins the entire series.. At the same time, her character's intelligence is exaggerated, the connections made by the character are pathetic and it is clear that everything is forced and nothing is realistic..unfortunately it could have been an ok series, but with such a detective, it becomes boring and disappointing.nnLet's hope that if there is a second season, we don't see such a brilliant detective again, otherwise it will be a total failure.

This is my firat ever review on imdb.nnI am not talking about the cheesy lines all throughout the movie, don't really care much about the boring cliches... It could have been entertaining for a night you wanted to watch a cheesy romance. BUT, I mean for a movie about a fashion magazine the leading lady (a fashion designer) and the leading guy couldn't have dressed worse. She dresses like she has not bought anything since the 2000s, and let's say she likes retro-ish, the clothes do not fit her. Somewhere in the beginning, a lady asks who she's wearing and she says it's her design, the lady is awed. That outfit looked like it was picked up from a discount store in 2000s. In one scene I was so distracted by a shirt she was wearing where the shirt was so tight on the chest that the buttons almost ripped apart. This beautiful young lady portraying a promising fashion designer should have had a better stylist while filming-I am shouting out to producers, scenarists or whoever made the movie. The outfits are miserable. I was also horrified by the sketches she showed around. Couldn't you hire a fashion designer student who would have drawn something better? Has noone thought she should have been fitted in somethings more fashionable? I mean, come on. Everytime someone praised to those horrible outfits, my eyeballs almost fell out, my head felt dizzy and I almost had a heart attack. Poor girl, she deserved better!

This is about what it means to be seen, and feeling invisible seems like part of many trans people's lives, because our real self exists beyond the illusion, this is why only through delusion=de-illusion we can penetrate the veil and see each other. The physical transition allows the inner self to emerge and challenge the narratives of the illusion to help people enter something far more real. This used to be one of the ways how trans people as Berdache were serving within indigenous cultures. The ego only accuses others of being delusional for not buying into its illusion, which feeds the narcissistic falsenself that is reduced into an object.nnThe love interest at the end of the film revealed how much physical disability was almost like a connecting bridge between them, however, it is more than that, it is a search for depth and transcendence by those who have various physical disabilities, it is an exchange, in order to embody ourselves fully, sometimes we need to let go of some things, and a conventional beauty can be one of them, because it serves a homogenous norms and standards, which the ideology of sex binary has been providing for generations already to hold the paradigm within the master vs slave hierarchy. However, when you try to bring down into the body your own higher dimensional self, in a sense you can also manage to bring heaven or paradise down to earth. This is also one major reason why trans people used to be revered as sacred in many cultures for containing this ever-present potential to free humanity from a two dimensional consciosuness that keeps most humans in self induced prison. It can change the way we relate to others, it makes us humble, balanced and highly intelligent, because we operate at higher frequencies of the light. This is the sacrifice many trans people make, the way you see the world heals the world, and people connecting to you can be transformed by it. This is why trans people are so important as highlighters.nnHowever, if the wider public can truly understand transgender people, it can not happen without exploring multi-dimensionality by deconstructing patriarchal narratives of what is a woman that perpetuate the oppression of women, because humans exist in the trinity of time, space and consciousness rooted in the Elemental Law of 3 (proton/electron/neutron), let it be understood that humans do not exist in duality of man and woman outside of ourselves, but trinity of man and woman within ourselves, this ignorance is what largely cultivated an epidemic of narcissism in our society through the fragmentation of our psyche, but also managed to reduce humans into an object or pieces of meat. Trans people are an embodiment of men and women as multi-dimensional subjects the same like art, dolls, etc. This is why this world can never truly get into the depth of trans people, and neither many trans people themselves, unless people start exploring the true nature of reality we live in from a scientific standpoint, which would also help in understanding autistic people, this is why it can be so hard to explain what is really happening on the inside. This kind of movie is still waiting to be made, which could become revolutionary and even life-changing, because most people still live in complete and utter ignorance about trans people, enough that politicians have been exploiting it to erase their existence to help the collective consciousness descend from the 3rd dimensions deeper into the 2nd to trap it in the matter, so that it could be controlled through the body. This is how trans people pose threat to the entire predatory paradigm based on exploitation.nnAll things are seen in terms of duality, however, by embodying both polarities, just like like those who can give and take away life through their own body (abortion), you gain consciousness as the authority over duality. When you turn the lights on or off, the consciousness is given authority to determine whether it is on or off. Not the outside authority. Time, Space and Consciousness become unified into Mother Trinity. Which consequently takes the power away from the biblical Male Godhead, this is how it permeates into Abrahamic religion and its programming.nnThe only use for binary thinking is purely utilitarian for those instances in which consciousness, through its persona, attempts to delineate which aspects of reality it wishes to presently investigate but that delineation must always remain acknowledged as temporary and provisional lest a social cancer comprised of pathological personas fastens on to it as actually representative of reality. For example, there is no way to absolutely define up versus down without referring either to an absolute position in space (the strong absolutist method) or the self preserving unitary position of the persona (the weak absolutist - narcissistic method).nnThe only truthful and accurate definition would be the relativist method that each point in space has its own up and down - much as each persona has its own self and non self. These two absolutist methods make use, symbolically speaking, of three nails: two horizontal (the strong absolutist method, with its reliance on one nail for good and another for evil) and the third for the vertical axis (the weak absolutist method, with its reliance on one nail for its one point of reference). But reality is neither two-dimensional, for there is a third dimension for which there exists no nail that the pathologically inhibited persona can conceive of, nor is it only three dimensional, for there exists time within which consciousness expands, nor is it only four dimensional, for there exists the unification of all reality within the fully expanded consciousness. The only evil is that which inhibits consciousness. And the fundamental inhibitor of consciousness is binary/two-dimensional consciousness of Man above and Woman below that burns the bridge that allows one to access the other, where the subject merges with the object to embody trinity/unity/heart/mystery/feminine.nnIn this way one can notice the paradox that trans women might be in a sense more real women and trans men more real men, because they are uncovering their real selves that laid dormant, whereas those who cling to labels and enforcing them onto others are more prone to their narcissistic false persona that controls them. Man and Woman are multi-dimensional, once that is recognized and fully embodied, the way you present yourself can reflect it all of a sudden. Trans people are a bridge to a more authentic world where people feel free to be more of who they are. Make no mistake, it is a bridge towards the freedom for all human beings on earth.nnThe film Matrrix was based on this soul searching journey that real trans people are undergoing, which the society attached to the matrix are pathologizing and dehumanizing, because they are protecting the 3D duality matrix system that suppresses the 'truth' existing within the symbolical number 3 and its whole curvature that represents the feminine, this is reflected back by the oppression of women and mother nature herself on this planet. It is the space that frees the mind and brings it back in touch with one's true nature stored in the unconscious, the higher self.nnIt has to be understood that many autistic and trans people in general are embodying an energetic intelligence that other people are either not biologically endowed with, or it remains dormant within them, and scientific evidences are already pointing in that direction.nnFirst of all, this kind of film should explore the depths of gender dysphoria rooted in biological gender identity that directs your own entire life. The smell, anatomy, language, sound, psychosomatic symptoms, etc.nnSecondly, delving into multiple challenges in life that serve as energetic messages to the body that is speaking back to the mind asking what it needs and how it needs you to embody it, the same like when it needs to eat, exercise, sleep, and so on.nnThirdly, and most importanly, it needs to explore the truth of what it means being human. This is why the filmmakers would perhaps benefit from reading Cosmic Mother by Monica Sjoo exploring the mistakes humans have made in the Bronze Age patriarchal ontology, mistakes about the nature of being and the nature of human being in this world, including what is natural and real, and how we need to re-discover our ancient practices and relationships to mother earth herself, which consequently becomes reflected by the harmonious state of human beings on this planet.nnClose To You is poetic and symbolical, and I am grateful for having been able to read into it, it left me emotionally exhausted, but most people will probably miss the whole nuance and depth that permeates it. Let's hope films like this help people to help and encourage children to transition before unnatural puberty damages their body, so they could self actualize in a natural way, because what's truly natural is when the inner and outer worlds meet in harmony and not when nature is weaponized in order to trap the spirit in the matter by controlling the mind through it, this kind of psychotic mindset led to lobotomies and experiments by Mengele in Nazi Germany, this is how the authoritarian regimes used to rely on pathologization as a way how to disconnect people from their own inner nature. People who play God see all puberty as natural for all humans, because they have denied people their own nature already, this is the entire paradox, let it be perfectly understood that this is a predatory consciousness, it is a belief system that is imposed upon people to suppress nature. These people can not see what they are being manipulated to perpetuate because of their own ignorance of how energy works from a scientific standpoint, let alone Mother Nature herself. Understanding and holding the paradox within heals the world while allowing people to ascend in their own spirit.

"JUST WATCHED 'CAPERNAUM' AND I'M STILL REELING FROM THE EXPERIENCE!nnThis powerful Lebanese drama film tells the story of Zain, a young boy who sues his parents for bringing him into a world of suffering. With outstanding performances, breathtaking cinematography, and a thought-provoking narrative, 'Capernaum' is a must-watch for anyone who cares about social justice and humanity.nnWhat struck me most was Zain's desperate attempt to shield his sister from the harsh realities of their world, hiding her budding womanhood from their parents. His courage in trying to flee with his sister, driven by a fierce determination to save her, left me in awe.nnThe film's portrayal of the struggles of migrant workers and refugees, as embodied by the Ethiopian immigrant Rahil, added depth and nuance to the narrative. Zain Al Rafeea's performance as the titular character is phenomenal, conveying a depth of emotion and vulnerability that is rare in child actors.nnThe climax of the film is a masterclass in emotional storytelling, as Zain's fragile world comes crashing down, leaving the viewer breathless and heartbroken.nn'Capernaum' is a film that will stay with you long after the credits roll. It's a powerful indictment of systemic neglect and the failure of societal safety nets. If you haven't seen it yet, please do. It's a film that will break your heart, but also give you hope for a better world.

Here's a perspective from a normal guy who was excited that there might be a promising horror movie. The production is ok, with nice costumes, cool settings and quite an interesting video perspective. But there it ends for me. We have a poorly designed vampire pumping an astonishing 7 words per minute while looking like a decomposing hill billy. We have a hefty share of necrophilia. We have quite a lot of softcore porn and we have a lot of disgusting (but not really scary) scenes. I feel like the message of the movie can be told without the vulgarity. Under no circumstances should you take underage people to this movie or plan to eat out after going to the movie.

And it is meandering. It starts about one thing. Then it's another thing. And another thing. And another thing. And another thing. And before it winds back to being how all this things are connected, it just becomes exhausting and a big so-what.nnIt's not Seven. It's not Silence of the Lambs. It's not Zodiac. And it's not good.nnIf it was just about the Lumberjack figure and the lore, it probably would have been much better. But, instead, it has to be twenty-five different genres with a hundred unlikable characters and seventy-three thousand plot threads.nnBy the end, I just didn't care anymore.

I rarely every write reviews for movies but this one... Oh my god. It's literally the WORST movie I have seen in a cinema in YEARS.nnThe movie is literally made up of small clips like instagram/youtube shorts, there is no continuity. Editing is so bad.nnStory is just so average.nnDon't know why a hindi movie playing in Delhi ncr had english subtitles. Dialogues style itself is so weird that at times, movie felt like it is dubbed from south india.nnHalf the movie shows the "past time" of the characters. Waste of plot and time of viewers.nnLost all respect for Varun Dhawan.nnSave yourselves and skip this.

A truly epic cinematic experience that touches your soul before ripping it out with a gusto that is thorough unapologetic and torn through every available orifice. This is a film that seems superficial and playful upon first inspection, yet on closer review it is deeply symbolic and wrestles with many topics at once.nnThe Substance is sculpted to excite every sense; music challenges you, graphics assault you and cinematography disturbs you as much as the narrative and delivery of the actors. Nothing is left to chance.nnIt's wonderfully graphic and a horrifically watchable, darkly comedic feast.

column3: Where the Dead Go to Die (2012)
column4: Where the Dead Go to Die is, frankly put, terrible. From the horrible PS1-esque animation, the atrocious voice acting, the edgy shock value, to the non-existent plot, it's a mess. As much of a disaster as this film is, there are some things I respect about it.nnThe animation, despite looking awful, was made by one person, and for that, I can't insult it too much. The voice actors had little experience also, so that's forgivable. The best thing about the movie by far though is that it has some really fascinating, cleverly-created trippy sequences and unique monsters which are unlike anything I've seen before. I strongly commend the creator's attempt at these, as, not only are they hard to animate and present, but they are very complex in what they depict, so much detail is required. It is very clear that this film was made as a passion project, since the animator (who is also the writer, director, and one of the voice actors) put so much focus and effort in dream-like sequences.nnHowever, what keeps this movie from being good is its desperate attempts are transgressiveness. The movie tries to shock you, almost to the point where it's embarrassing. The film is full of chock-full of the most extreme depravities and evils just for the sake of it being there. When it a movie tries so hard to be disturbing and transgressive like this, it backfires and the tryhard edginess becomes practically tangible, so much so, that it stops being disturbing and becomes more so eyeroll-inducing. The film has next to every taboo you can imagine in it, and it revels in its ability to do that since it's animated. This film is gore-porn in the purest sense of the term, and for that, I dislike this film. The interesting surreal visuals, monsters, and scenes cannot save this movie from being awful exploitation film.

Spencer Tracy plays one of seven men who escape from a German concentration camp and then is systematically hunted down.nnThe film takes place before WWII proper broke out, so these men are people who the Nazis have identified as subversive and not loyal to the Nazi cause. The film becomes a cat and mouse game of "who can you trust?" Tracy slinks through shadowy streets, calls in favors, takes chances on regular German townfolk and hopes they won't turn him in. Hume Cronyn and Jessica Tandy have large supporting roles as a married couple who take him in and help connect him to the German resistance. Cronyn received the only Oscar nomination of his career for his performance.nnThis is a solidly made early film by Fred Zinnemann that lacks the sentiment, histrionics, and propaganda that defined so many other movies from the same time period and that would become a hallmark of his filmmaking style.nnGrade: A-

I just finished the game for the first time. I'll say just one thing.....please try it for yourself, and try it beyond the opening hour or so. When I first started I was a little disappointed, it felt stilted, but I love Dragon age so I persisted. And I am so happy I did. It opened up into an epic experience. There were some epic, goosebumps moments, sad moments, fun moments. I am caring for my mom at the moment, she's going through heavy cancer treatment-playing this game when she was sleeping was the only time I was truly distracted.....so thank you Bioware for that.nnWhen I got to the final fight sequence, it was unbelievable, like something from lotr. Do yourself a favour and don't listen to YouTubers, just try it. The combat is fun, the companions are varied and interesting. I've finished Inquisition I think 5 times now, and this is just as good. Just try this with an open mind and take what you can as an individual from it, I think you'll have a blast. Life is short, just live it and have fun!!

Santa Tell Me, the movie about a magic Christmas note that writes itself and forces dudes to fall for a woman, is a rollicking good time during parts of the movie. In other parts of the movie, it is an emotional masterpiece. And still in other parts of the movie, it is pure terror. My wife and I watched this the other night to close out Hallmark's three month run of Christmas movies. My wife fell asleep during the movie. She briefly woke up after the movie ended and I was watching Sportscenter and asked groggily if the main lady ended up with the guy yet. I told my wife that all the main characters were killed in a fiery boat accident where drinking was involved. That seemed to satisfy my wife's question, and she went back to sleep.nnThe actual movie, which focused on an HGTV show host relentlessly dating several dudes named Nick, was far less believable. I watched it to the end of the movie, and then poured one out for another successful Hallmark Christmas movie run - even though that was the first Hallmark movie I really watched this holiday season. But at least it had Chin-Implant Guy, who is becoming a staple of my holiday seasons. Bring on January!

My Old Ass is a delightful blend of humor and introspection, skillfully directed by Megan Park. The film follows 18-year-old Elliott, portrayed by Maisy Stella, who meets her 39-year-old future self (Aubrey Plaza) during a trippy journey of self-discovery. Their interactions are heartfelt, funny, and thought-provoking, shedding light on the complexities of growing up, self-acceptance, and the weight of life choices. Plaza and Stella deliver stellar performances, balancing comedy with emotional depth. With clever dialogue and a fresh perspective, My Old Ass is a must-watch for fans of coming-of-age films that leave a lasting impression.

Nice action scenes but the storyline is weak compare to Pushpa 1. Pushpa 1 story is powerful. But overall good movie, you can go and watch just for entertainment. People appreciate action in movies like James bond and Mission impossible but they start make fun of action in our movies.nnAll characters in the movie are good, the kali maha kali song was amazing, look of allu arun is wynorrific. The dance in that song is something unique. The fight scene are very violent but very nicely picturised. The dialogues are also very good.nnI love this movie paisa wasool action movie. Waiting for pushpa 3.

Today, I watched one of the best documentary movies I've ever seen. It had a perfect balance of insightful information and engaging storytelling. The film presented its points in a clear and impactful way, making even complex topics easy to understand. What truly stood out was its unexpected humor, which added a lighthearted touch to certain moments without undermining the seriousness of the subject. It kept me hooked from start to finish, and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for an enjoyable and thought-provoking experience. I have laughed to much on some scenes as I didn't expect I laugh while I'm watching a documentary about a serious topic.

What a terrible episode with Taylor Sheridan killing the whole show for no reason.nnNo wonder, Kevin Costner left. All that jibberish and writing himself up like that. He ruined the beth's character as well with this.nnCasting Bella hadid as girlfriend ? You must be so freaking desperate to portray such characters like that. The scene where RIP talks about how he met travis was super ultra cringe fest.nnAbsolute pathetic and garbage character like travis taking down a show to this level is highly disappointing.nnWhen I started yellowstone I had pretty high hopes but here we are, at the end of a brilliant show where taylor sheridan wanted every viewer to notice him.

column3: Rogue Elements: A Ryan Drake Story (2024)
column4: Wow. It's so odd how Critical Drinker knows how to fix other movies then writes the most clich√©d Jack Ryan rip off possible. It proves that it's not wokeness that makes a film awful, it's a script that literally feels like it's written by AI... Or a 13 year old.nnI haven't read the books (and certainly won't now) but can guess they are the same kind of cliche spy stuff where characters constantly say "sit rep" etc.nnApart from the script it's all pretty standard, nothing to make it stand out from the crowd of low budget actioners. The directing, photography, grade, music are all just obvious. Again, like an AI project.nnI look forward the a YouTube review of this in the style of Drinker. It deserves it, and maybe in future, the Drinker will have a little more respect for writers, especially as their work is a million times better than his.

So after a long wait of 25+ years, I've witnessed this beautiful movie which is based on patriotic cop action thriller scheduled on the time period of Kargil war. WoW I can simply feel the passion of audiences who have witnessed this brilliant movie at that particular time period.nnActing performance of AAmir Khan was top notch, Sonali Bendre was so sweet in her little screen time, the dialogues (shayeri) of Nasheruddin Shah will steal your heart and a special mention to Mukesh Rishi, WoW this is the first ever time when I have witnessed his good side in a bollywood movie and he just nailed his role superbly here.. The Action sequences were top notch, screenplay was pretty tight despite it belongs to that old era where 3hr runtime is commonly visible in such movies. The editor worked superbly to trimmed it down as per the requirements.nnAnd now my favorite section in this movie is it's "MUSIC" woooooowwww... Those are such soulful tracks which rules over in my heart since my childhood to adulthood now and I'm damn sure these songs will rule over my soul till I attain my old age with my soulmate.nnHoshwalon ko Khabar Kya, Zindagi Maut na Ban jaaye, Jo Haal dil ka these are my top favorite tracks from here..nnOverall a best movie to go with family and definitely recommending to watch it at least once in your life.. From my side it will be 8 out of 10 Stars for it..

The movie is made well. Technically and actors wise all is fine. The Plot didn't catch me at all but this counts for me personally. I guess some people will like it. So you should watch it to judge for yourself. Do not expect scenes like in Schindlers List. This movie is slow and full of conversations. There are no scandalous scenes or scenes with explicit grafic violence. The story is only giving hints of awful happenings but is never showing anything to picture those actions. Some will like this but for me i was missing a bit of getting shocked with possible pictures of violence. Its not that i like it it is more the impact of triggering anxiety so i will always be aware of the danger of nationalism. Nowadays many Racists are powerful again in politics. Racism is a sickness and crime.

Nosferatu (2024) is the kind of remake that makes you wonder if some things are better left in the past. It tries so hard to be "artsy" and "evocative" but ends up just being a pretentious, overstyled mess. The visuals? Sure, they're pretty in a way that screams "look at me, I'm deep," it's not very sigma but the whole film feels like a mood board thrown into a blender. I can't tell if they're trying to make you feel unsettled or just nauseous or like an old man on his death bed. Unless you want to feel these things I strongly advise you to not watch it because the whole time it felt like I was watching cheap Diddy porn. And sadly I made the unfortunate mistake of watching it with my family because of this movie my family doesn't talk to me anymore.

12th Fail is an emotionally gripping and profoundly inspiring film that captures the resilience of the human spirit. Based on true events, it beautifully portrays the struggles, failures, and triumphs of those striving for greatness. The storytelling is heartfelt and authentic, with performances that bring raw emotion and relatability to the screen. The film's direction is masterful, blending moments of despair and hope seamlessly, leaving a lasting impression. It's not just a movie but a lesson in perseverance and determination. 12th Fail is a must-watch for anyone seeking inspiration, it is one of the movie masterpiece.

Enjoyed watching it twice, great intelligent humor which is not common in Serbian movies. Story is well put together and connected, most of the actors are great and sound natural, unlike in some other older movies where actors sound too formal. Interesting idea behind the movie, unexpected plot twist. Good portration of how some of the characters are affected mentally by what happened, though for those that are not in the wild I think it would be too soon in real life to start behaving the way they did. The gay scene is not explicit just tense making out shirtless. The movie portrays human behavior in extreme environment, putting their humanity to test. I would watch it again and would recommend. Some of the reviews online claim it's terrible due to different political views so be sceptic about those comments that are too extreme.

I am very sorry to say that, but it felt so cheap and not classy. As if the whole models were collected from gypsy suburbs, but there were actually very good models, but the whole atmosphere made me feel so. The show also had obese models but didn't include any anorexic models, so I guess body positivity is for triple-plus-size people, but not the other way around. People then would probably say, but anorexia is an illness. Yes, so does obesity. Inclusivity is a big yes, but let's not glamorize unhealthy life choices. I love Rihanna, by the way, and I was so excited to see it since there was no Victoria's Secret Fashion Show back at that time, but the show was a disappointment.

24 Hours in Police Custody is a documentary series highlighting the crimes that occur every single day in Bedfordshire (or others close). This is one of those series where the people who are making these, clearly want to show no bounds in terms of graphic images. They want you to look at reality in the eye. And for a documentary series that mostly revolve around murders, drugs, rapes, I have to say, and honored, they are absolutely spectacular at doing it.nnI always go back to watch episodes of 24 Hours, because it is very interesting to see just how devious, foolish, or organized these criminals are in each episode. It almost makes you feel like a detective, and you're there. You'd feel half the vibes in this series, because it is extremely bleak (but not a putting-off bleak). The series itself is intense with its investigations, and that just adds to the authenticity. I wouldn't be surprised if this show got slammed by viewers, it's extremely realistic, and incredible.

My Old Ass is a heartfelt and humorous exploration of aging, resilience, and finding purpose in unexpected places. The protagonist's journey, full of quirky encounters and witty dialogue, balances comedy and emotion beautifully. The film excels in showcasing the struggles and triumphs of embracing life's later stages, thanks to a standout performance by the lead actor. While the pacing lags slightly in the middle, its charm and relatability make it a poignant watch. A thoughtful reminder to laugh, love, and live fully, no matter your age. It's a film that will leave you smiling and reflecting on life's beauty.

This was painfully boring. Despite jimin and Jungkook being in the same band, it goes to show that they aren't in the same circle of friends outside of BTS. This whole show especially the Japan episode was enough for one episode. Jimin was so cringey and as usual Jungkook carried the show with his cuteness and being himself.nnHybe made this show out of desperation, no wonder no local channels want to buy this. It will really show the real ratings and not imdb rating from shippers who try to save this pathetic show.nnSeason one should be the first and the last. Even the merch never sold out. That's very telling.

"Wednesday" is a supernatural mystery series that follows Wednesday Addams at Nevermore Academy as she hones her psychic powers and solves a murder tied to her family. Jenna Ortega shines as the witty, gothic protagonist, and Tim Burton's signature aesthetic adds a striking visual appeal.nnHowever, some side characters and subplots feel underdeveloped, and the pacing can be uneven, especially in the middle episodes. Despite these minor flaws, "Wednesday" is a fun, modern homage to the Addams Family, offering a mix of humor, mystery, and gothic intrigue that's perfect for fans of supernatural stories.

When "Spirited Away" (Sen to Chihiro no Kamikakushi) won the Academy Award for Best Animated Feature in 2003, it wasn't just a historic moment as the first non-English language film to do so-it was a well-deserved recognition of Hayao Miyazaki's unparalleled artistry as a filmmaker. Released in 2001, this Studio Ghibli masterpiece is a mesmerizing journey into a fantastical world filled with wonder, mystery, and profound emotional depth.nnThe story follows Chihiro, a 10-year-old girl who stumbles into a spirit world while moving to a new town with her parents. After her parents are transformed into pigs by consuming enchanted food, Chihiro must navigate this strange realm and find a way to free them and return home. To survive, she takes a job in Yubaba's mystical bathhouse, where she encounters an array of spirits, gods, and magical beings, each more fascinating than the last.nnWhat makes "Spirited Away" so remarkable is its ability to weave an enchanting tale that appeals to both children and adults. At its core, the film is a coming-of-age story about resilience, self-discovery, and compassion. Chihiro's transformation from a timid, uncertain girl into a courageous and resourceful young heroine is beautifully nuanced, making her one of Miyazaki's most relatable protagonists.nnThe animation is nothing short of breathtaking. Every frame is a work of art, from the lush green landscapes of the spirit world's outskirts to the intricate details of Yubaba's bathhouse and its many unique spirits. Miyazaki fills the screen with vibrant colors and imaginative designs that feel otherworldly yet grounded. Memorable characters like the enigmatic No-Face, the dragon-like Haku, and the grotesquely charming Yubaba are brought to life with stunning creativity.nnJoe Hisaishi's score enhances the magical atmosphere with melodies that evoke both wonder and melancholy. The music becomes a character in itself, amplifying the film's emotional resonance.nnBeyond its stunning visuals and compelling narrative, "Spirited Away" is a story about balance-between greed and generosity, nature and industry, and the spirit and human worlds. Miyazaki masterfully captures these themes without becoming preachy, leaving viewers with a sense of awe and introspection.nnIt remains one of the finest animated films ever made and deserving of its Academy Award.

Attack on Titan is a close second to vinland saga in best animes I have ever seen. Although some things were quite predictable, I still audibly gasped at some scenes. The character building is great and although a lot of people might not agree, I think that the ending is perfect. It just shows how far Eren is willing to go to save humanity, he is the only one who truly gets it.nnI love how this show slowly gives you more and more information about the world they are living in. In every episode there is a short scene of information that makes sure you keep up with the characters and their world. Because of this you truly feel as if you know this fictional world and then boom, plottwist.nnOverall just one of the best shows ever.

column3: "The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power" (2022) {Shadow and Flame (#2.8)}
column4: I found the first season of "The Rings of Power" to be average confusing and a bit dull at first though picking up towards the end. I couldn't largely use that same review here for the second season.nnWith the rings starting to take a hold in the seats of Middleearth, Sauron (Charlie Vickers) convinces Adar (Sam Hazeldine) the leader of the Orc army to march on the Elven city of Eregion. Sauron heads there first, and with a new identify convinces Celebrimbor (Charles Edwards) to create rings for the Dwarves and later the humans. The ring has an immediate corrupting influence on King Durin (Peter Mullan) further driving a wedge between him and his son (Owain Arthur).nnThere are also continuations of the storylines of "The Stranger" including Tom Bombadil and confirmation that he is, who we thought he was. There are the continuing adventures of Isildur which make sense to me as I know where he ends up. The political manoeuvring at Numenor thought I'm baffled as to why we're seeing so much of that.nnAs with the first run, I struggled to maintain much interest in the first few episodes. I would say though, that whereas in that run I only really got on board for the last two, this time it was probably the last four (if this trend continues, I should properly be enjoying the show by season four). I'd say that it was because there was much more focus in the second half of the series on the elements that I cared about, the nightmares forming at Eregion and in the mines of Khazad-dum and less on .. well .. everything else.nnI should reiterate that, whilst the show still isn't perhaps amongst the ones I am most looking forward to, it is improving and I'll again be back for the third season.

Presents an interesting idea exploring the challenges of aging in a unique way. The concept is original with moments that offers a glimpse of something heart-warming and humorous, but the film doesn't live up to it's potential. The pacing is sometimes slow, often lingering on scenes that feel drawn out, making it hard to stay fully engaged. While some moments of humor work well, they are scattered, leaving the film feeling inconsistent and sometimes dragging on without much to hold onto..nnThe lead actor's performance is descent, adding a bit of warmth to the character, but it lacks the depth.

No, "The Brylcreem Boys" is not a documentary about men's hair dressing in the 1940's, nor does it feature actual boys as main characters. It is a poorly done slap in the face of those involved in World War II Europe.nnCanadian R. A. F. Pilot Myles Keogh (Bill Campbell) and his crew are shot down over what they think is France. They are arrested and transported to the local Irish prisoner of war camp. It seems Ireland is neutral in the war, holding captured British soldiers on one side of the camp, and captured Nazi soldiers on the other side. One of the Nazis is Rudolph (Angus Macfayden), and both Myles and Rudolph fall for local gal Mattie (Jean Butler). Before you ask how Myles and Rudolph could fall for Mattie while locked away in prison, I'll tell you. It seems prison commander O'Brien (Gabriel Byrne, who coproduced this silliness) lets all the prisoners out on day release passes, as long as everyone agrees to return at night. Crazy and nutty, huh? Myles and Mattie, er, discover each other's Blarney Stone, Rudolph turns into one of the really good, nice, polite Nazis, and soon a poorly executed prison break is on.nnThe film makers had such a great opportunity here, it is too bad they squandered it on the sappy Myles/Mattie/Rudy love triangle. An Irish prison containing British and Nazi prisoners? One character calls it a "madhouse," and it should have been. I settled back for some "M*A*S*H"/"Catch-22"-style satire, but by the end of the film I would have been happy with some kicky doofus "Hogan's Heroes"/"Major Dad"-style hi-jinks. Campbell is a blank. He looks good, but is given nothing to do. "Rudolph the Nice Nazi" Macfayden is a villain, then not, then a villain, then not, then... Butler used to be in "Riverdance" so be warned that spontaneous yet flawlessly executed Irish jigging suddenly breaks out midway through the film. William McNamara plays an annoying American movie star, and Byrne just looks dire. The film ends with the most depressing "what ever happened to...?" coda since "American Graffiti," and I was emotionally empty. Sure, you have seen better films about Ireland ("The Quiet Man," "Cowboys & Angels," countless others), but when the British escape plan hinges on getting the Irish guards really drunk, 'cause ALL Irish are a bunch of swarthy alcoholics, you realize one half-baked idea does not make a good film. This story is 80 proof positive of that.

Nice movie I would like to watch it again. These are movies we need to be watching .. wow am recommending everyone to watch this movie .. come on n guy.let us do this guy's these are movies you can watch with your family and friends.................I will never get tired of this movie it is the best movie ever no matter what .......... I will even tell my friends about this movie yes you heard me right .. let's do this guy's the movie is here let's recommend it to our family and friends let's do this guy's.........these are movies we need to watch my old ass is the best of all movies I have watched.

Waiting and waiting for something to really happen... that is how I could briefly describe this movie.nnThe synopsis on IMDB seemed to describe a really interesting plot.nnBut my impression at the end of the movie was... disappointed. Disappointed after waiting for two hours for something interesting or unexpected to happen, disappointed after having to watch whole musical pieces being sung and for something to eventually start happening after them. But it never did.nnThere was then the sequence in the bar with little bits of dialogue of various people sewn together for no apparent purpose (what were they supposed to say? What was the meaning of this whole nonsense?).nnI found the whole experience disheartening and having not much to do with the plot as described.

I am a big Ferry fan, but Ferry 2 is really disappointing.nnIt's not because of Frank Lammers (Ferry), his acting is always great! But the rest of the cast is very, very poor. Aiko, who plays Jes, is a boring actress, she has no facial expressions and voice is monotone.nnBut worst of all is the very poor acting of Jonas Smulders, who plays Lex. He is the worst actor I have seen in a long time.nnThe story is more of the same: having trouble making enough pills in a short amount of time. Then the other group gets angry. Very little difference compared to Ferry 1 and Ferry the Series.nnI gave 5 starts only because Frank Lammers' acting is great.

This is one of the great story have ever watched in 2024,My Old Ass is a coming of age story that merges elements of a stoner comedy with some low tech time travel to great effect. It's so funny and easy to like but its greatest strength comes from the emotional core and the beautiful messages which come from it. It's a winning argument about how life is messy, scary and full of extremely painful heartbreak however, that only makes it all the more important to take the risks and enjoy the best moments.nnMaisy Stella gives an amazing lead performance, starting off unaware of what she's about to leave behind which allows her to grow over the course of the film and her internal struggles as she discovers new things about herself unfold in a really earnest fashion. Aubrey Plaza is only on screen for two scenes and it's so impressive how funny she is in the first one and how much emotion she brings to the second. Percy Hynes White nails his part as someone who is supposed to be a red flag but his actions only confirm the opposite.nnAs writer & director Megan Park delivers a breezily entertaining film that consistently looks nice thanks to its scenic locations and ability to hone in on the smaller details that mean everything before delivering a well earned emotional gut punch at the end. All the dialogue feels authentic without ever coming across as unintentionally awkward and there's a lot of fun to be had in catching the small details Aubrey Plaza lets slip about this version of the future.

After viewing a 'A Cure for Wellness' in the hopes of seeing a worthwhile thriller, all I got was this evil homage to Satan! I feel I need to bleach my eyes and erase my memory. This audio visual vomit is nothing more than a siren call to all the stinking perverts and Godless vermin out there, to titillate them, and get them fired up enough to go and repeat the disugusting acts found in the film. The director Gore Verbinski has no doubt already commited such pedophile acts on a number of poor wretched victims who are either pushing up the daisies now, or have their lives left in absolute ruins by these creatures that inhabit the utterly evil Hollywood machine. How actors such as Dane DeHaan agreed to contaminate themselves with this poison is beyond me. The cast, the writers, even the light crew - anybody who contributed to 'A Cure for Wellness' are all complicite in all of the sexual crimes this film has advertised. May your guilt either shame you into changing yourselves for the better, or may it carry you to hell where you deserve to burn forever. Sadly, movies of this evil type are only going to increase and audience numbers decrease before things get better for the world. Do not give these Hollywood creeps one dime of your money.

"My Old Ass" is a film starring Maisy Stella. Here's a review:nn"My Old Ass" is a heartwarming and humorous film that explores themes of identity, family, and self-discovery. Maisy Stella shines in the lead role, bringing a relatable and endearing quality to the character.nnThe movie's tone is well-balanced, seamlessly shifting between comedic moments and more poignant scenes. The supporting cast adds depth and warmth to the story.nnOverall, "My Old Ass" is a delightful and uplifting film that will resonate with audiences of all ages. Maisy Stella's standout performance makes this movie a must-watch.

The strange title made me very curious about what this film was, and I am glad I found the time to watch it. Megan Park's My Old Ass is such a sweet coming-of-age film that is oozing with charm. Here we find an 18-year-old young woman (played by Maisy Stella) who, through magic mushrooms and other unexplained occurrences, finds a way to communicate with her 39-year-old self (played by Aubrey Plaza) from the future. That is about all you need to know about the film, and, even if you have reservations about watching something with unexplained timey-wimey mechanics, I would suggest that you should get over that and enjoy this film for what it is, even though I, too, sometimes, raised an eyebrow at the mechanics of it all.

You should watch it if you haven't. The film's exploration of identity, time, and personal growth, combined with its unique premise, has resonated with audiences. Its setting in the scenic lakes of Ontario adds a romantic and wistful atmosphere, enhancing the narrative's emotional depth.nnOverall, "My Old Ass" is considered a charming and thoughtful addition to the coming-of-age genre, offering a blend of humor and introspection that appeals to a wide audience.nnThe film stars Maisy Stella as Elliott, an 18-year-old on the cusp of college, who, after consuming psychedelic mushrooms, encounters her 39-year-old future self, portrayed by Aubrey Plaza. This unexpected meeting leads Elliott to reflect on her current life choices and future aspirations.

So I love most shows in the medical field and this was still on a few years ago. I used to watch every week and now that it's on the Pop channel and I watched it still. Then the 2016 election season happened. Some of these stars on this show I love, were suddenly becoming more political and actually more polarizing because the country didn't choose the lady they wanted. I finally broke down and started watching again on Hulu. I see some things a little different. Like in this episode "Middle of Nowhere" that has Benton working in a very rude/untrusting. Although all the characters besides the TRACTOR FAMILY, The Ebie's, and the nurse the only ones were the black Americans. I think everyone did an amazing job and that's not the issue at all. My "issue" was that most of the people treated Benton like garbage and it pisses me off. I have never and will never support people like that. I do like that he stood up for himself and that he wasn't the type to take without saying a word but I really wish they had done something different to show bias and that other abhorrent behavior towards Benton as a black man. There are so many other way to describe and combat it.

The script of My Old Ass is precisely that, simple but that invites you to think about yourself, to put yourself in the place of the protagonist and ask yourself "What would you do?".nnMy Old Ass is a coming of age story that merges elements of a stoner comedy with some low tech time travel to great effect. It's so funny and easy to like but its greatest strength comes from the emotional core and the beautiful messages which come from it. It's a winning argument about how life is messy, scary and full of extremely painful heartbreak however, that only makes it all the more important to take the risks and enjoy the best moments.

column3: Barbie as the Princess and the Pauper (2004) (V)
column4: I saw this movie at a Goodwill while trying to find Aladdin but I couldn't find Aladdin so I got this one instead. I do not regret anything from watching this movie except for the fact it maybe made me a little too obsessed with the villain, Preminger. After watching this entire movie, I can't understand why people call Preminger gay, because he went after women the entire movie. That aside, this is an AMAZING movie. Initially I was worried that I wouldn't like it or that I'd get bored halfway through but I watched and enjoyed the entire movie! Also I have a theory that Preminger survived and ran off because his "defeat" was just him crashing on top of a table with cake on his head, which is huge nuisance but it certainly won't hurt or kill you. Also, they never talk about him when they talk about the others, so I think he ran away and either went to another kingdom or he is in hiding. I don't think he died because the movie showed how he almost killed Annalise and Julian by trapping them in the mine and he talks about them dying and making it look like an accident and then he later blames Erica for it, so if he died the movie would have mentioned it, but it didn't so he definitely ran away.

This movie was amazing, if you haven't yet watched it please watch it now. I give it a 10/10nI just watched "my old ass" and I'm still trying to process the sheer retro-ness of it all.nnThe plot is a nostalgic trip back to the good ol' days, with a healthy dose of cheesy dialogue, questionable fashion choices, and special effects that will make you laugh or cry, depending on your sense of humor.nnThe acting? Well, let's just say it's... enthusiastic. The cast gives it their all, even if their all is a bit cringeworthy at times.nnDespite its age, "my old ass" still manages to entertain. It's a time capsule of a bygone era, a reminder of the movies that used to be.nnSo, if you're feeling nostalgic or just want to experience a piece of cinematic history, give "my old ass" a watch. Just don't say I didn't warn you...nnRating:5/5 starsnRecommendation:Watch it with a group of friends, preferably with a healthy dose of irony and a few drinks.

The ferry arrives from Britain into the harbour at Douglas stuffed full of bikes and accoutrement ready for the impending TT race. Geoff Duke is there to meet an whole host of international riders, journalists and personalities as their racing bikes are taken to get them ready for the race. First practice is at 4.45am, and there's still a little fog as the riders set off - Bill Durham, Les Graham get away ok before some less enthusiastic models need more of an helping hand/jog to coax them into life. Bob Foster is on an Italian designed speedster and the brief coverage of this session begins in earnest featuring bikes taking some fairly tight corners whilst their mechanics do some tinkering afterwards. They have to stop at 6.15 so ordinary folks can get to work on the pubic roads so they've loads of time now to ruminate in the busy cocoa tent whilst they mix with the great and the good - and all before the first bacon sarnie of the day! A sporting rivalry between the UK and Italy on their Benelli and Guzzi machines is shaping up nicely and practice opportunities are keenly sought before there's time for an evening beer. When we do get into the race proper, I thought the coverage delivered rather well as the bikes race through these tiny hamlets ridden by Bell, Daniell, Duke and Bridge. There's loads of buzzing audio as these men must navigate bends like the "Goose Neck" on their 500cc kit. There's also some coverage of the 250cc race too, but mainly it focusses on the bigger engined race as they can reach speeds in excess of 125 mph. Artie Friend, Harold Daniell, Ted Keppell, Bob Foster, Geoff Duke, Les Graham, Johnny Lockett all averaging over 90 mph over the first lap and the editing and pace of commentary starts to build some excitement to please the rather static crowds. The photogenic Duke now does a lap averaging 93mph - a new course record. The language is sometime quite amusing, too - not often you hear "that's darned queer" nowadays. Well not about bikes, anyway. The score now starts to take a more prominent role as we head to the climax of this race, and it's going to be a close finish.

Patrick Swayze shines in his role as the charismatic boyfriend, while Demi Moore delivers a stellar performance as the enchanting and loving girlfriend. Whoopi Goldberg's portrayal as the supportive sidekick adds depth and charm to the film.nnHaving watched this movie over ten times, it continues to captivate and entertain, showcasing a perfectly executed storyline from start to finish. The innovative plot, coupled with superb acting from the entire cast, makes this film a standout. The screenplay is so exceptional that it truly merits an Oscar for its originality and depth.nnThis movie is a fantastic choice for a movie night, whether enjoyed alone or with friends, offering a timeless and engaging love story that rivals even the most iconic romantic films like "Titanic."nnEvery aspect of the film, from the direction to the cinematography, screenplay, and acting, is deserving of critical acclaim and recognition. The movie's soundtrack further enhances the emotional depth and impact of the storyline.nn"Ghost" beautifully illustrates that true love transcends time and mortality, making it a modern-day classic in the realm of Hollywood romance films. Patrick Swayze's performance in this film is a testament to his talent and contribution to the world of cinema, leaving behind a legacy that will always be remembered.

Review: "Kraven"nnAs a fan of superhero and villain films, I approached Kraven with optimism despite the lukewarm reviews. Unfortunately, even with my enthusiasm for the genre, this film proved to be a disappointment.nnThe casting is one of the few highlights-there's real potential in the performances, and some of the action sequences are well-executed and visually striking. However, these moments are overshadowed by a weak script that fails to build an engaging narrative or meaningful character development.nnThe script was left lacking and alongside poor story execution ended up leaving me feeling bored, which is the one thing a film within this genre shouldn't do. What could have been a gripping exploration of one of Spider-Man's most iconic villains instead feels hollow and unremarkable.nnWhile it's tempting to give superhero films the benefit of the doubt, this one simply doesn't earn it. Kraven is a slog, and for all but the most die-hard fans of the genre, it's best left unseen.nnRating: 3/10.

Providence is SO underrated! It was one of the best, mostly wholesome, tv show on the air in the late 90's/early 2000's. Melina Kanakredes was so good, but I think the other actors are also underrated. Paula Cale as Joanie, Seth Peterson as Robbie, Maria Pitillo as Robbie's wife, Tina, Dana Daurey as Dr. James Hansen's helper- Heather and of course, Mike Farrell as the dad. It gives me nostalgia watching it. I love the house set also. I'm waiting for it to be released on either DVD or on Amazon where I can buy all the seasons and watch them whenever I want. By far my favorite show. I wish it would have had a few more seasons. I looked forward to watching it every week, there weren't many shows that I looked forward to.
